name: Comfy bed, shrd bath  19min red subway to downtown
transit: SUBWAY: 7min walk to Jfk/Umass station on the red line, exit Columbia road from the platform (or Andrew square, 15min). Only 30 minute door to door to Harvard Square AIRPORT: take silver line to south station, then redline towards Braintree or Ashmont, and read subway instructions (free ticket from airport, plan for 45 minute with the change at south station) DRIVING: only a few blocks away from exit 15 from highway 93 If you have a car, this neighborhood might be your best option in the city. My street has parking restrictions, but only between the hours of 10am-2pm (4h!) Monday through Friday, and NOT on the weekends. If you have minimal need of your car during the week and want to store it in the driveway, we might be able to work out a cash parking fee once you are here (~$10/day).
access: The top lock on the front door should stay locked. Guests get their own key, however, it's very important to be quiet at night from 10pm-10am, and close doors very quietly (even front door) - I sleep near your bedroom and the stairway echoes (keep conversation for when you are in your room), so please be mindful. No unregistered guests or day visitors allowed unless cleared with me 24h in advance - you are responsible for all your guests all the time, whatever they end up doing on the premises. Storage parking during your stay might be available for cash payment in person.

Other than that, we personally don't own a car, since this is the center of the city.  We travel around mostly either on foot, by Hubway, or by public transportation.  All are very convenient and cheap. Airbnb won't show the website links to the above options on this page, but send us an email and we can forward you all the details.

I have two dogs (Beanie, brown dog, and Diamond, yellow lab mix) and a black tuxedo cat (Zozo) who do not have access to the unit, but they do spend time on the deck.  Diamond often sits on a couch by the window on the side and keeps an eye on the side of the house. I will introduce you so that they know you are a welcome guest. We also have a flock of wild turkeys who can be seen most days in the yard or behind the house in the woods. There is on-street parking, and we are very close to the T and several bus lines, Uber and Lyft cars, as well as to bike trails.

name: South End townhouse apt with deck

Planning on taking public transportation to your destinations? Don’t worry, Newbury Street runs with the Green Line, with train stops lining the street (Arlington, Copley, and Hynes Convention Center).

name: *Family*Massage Chair*Tourist/Convention/Ocean 37A
transit: It's walking distance (10 mins) from 2 red-line subways that will take you to downtown Boston and Cambridge. There is also a bus stop right out front. See the HOUSE MANUAL for parking tips. There is also Uber that can pickup/dropoff for inexpensive to downtown Boston. Approx $10 Uber ride to the Boston Convention Center (BCEC).
access: The entire unit (kitchen, bathroom, living room, bedrooms), and common laundry. Parking is often available on the street during the daytime and weekends, but much more difficult at night and during snow emergencies. Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11a check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, that is not the case here.

name: "Luxury 1BR Apt in Fenway Area
transit: These newly constructed, luxury apartments epitomize what it means to live well in one of Boston’s most eclectic and vibrant communities. An established neighborhood standout, the building’s apartments offer floor to ceiling windows with one of the most beautiful views of the Boston skyline. No matter what your preference, you’re within minutes of it all - Back Bay’s trendy shopping centers, Fenway’s endless entertainment, the best restaurants in Boston, and easy access to the Fenway T. The ease that comes with our 24 hour check in and concierge service, parking garage, as well as unparalleled on-site amenities makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

name: Spacious + Modern 4BR: Seaport/Conventions/Beach
transit: WALKING * Boston is a very walkable city BIKING * Hubway has locations throughout Boston  * Bike rental is available at MyBike in South Boston (15 minute walk) PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION * The  nearest bus stop is four blocks away  * The #9 bus takes you to Copley Square | Backbay | South End | Red Line Train * The #7 bus takes you to the Seaport District | Financial District | North End | South Station | Red Line Train CARSHARING * Zipcar has availability throughout Boston * Turo cars are available in our neighborhood  PARKING * Parking is not recommended.  There is street parking during the day but no overnight parking during the workweek.  On weekends, overnight parking anywhere west of L street (one block away) is available.   * If you must have a car, we'll recommend a garage during for your stay but please be aware it may be 1 +/- mile from the home if looking for a garage/lot.

name: Boston Seaport | Fort Point Luxury Escape+Parking
Come Home to Boston
transit: From Logan Airport, you have 3 options to get to my home: 1. Take the free airport shuttle to the MBTA. Take the MBTA subway to the "Orange line" train stop at Forest Hills station (it involves a switch that doesn't cost money).  From there, go to the Washington Street side of the station (not the Hyde Park Avenue side) and get bus #35, 36 or 37.  Get off at the Belgrade Avenue & Walworth Street stop (by 165 Belgrade Avenue).  Cross Belgrade Avenue and you will see Durnell Avenue immediately on your left.   My home is a 3-minute walk from there.   The MBTA website has a tab "Rider Tools" which will give you excellent, detailed routes and times to get anywhere in the city.   2. Take a Uber or Lyft the entire trip - which usually $29 to 37 from Logan Airport.  Boston Taxis are also readily available and will be higher. 3. Or you could follow step #1 to Forest Hills Station, then take a cab from there (they are lined up) to my home (about $8). 4. The Silver Line is also an option - you ca
access: You will have access to the front and side porches, the living room with TV, and the kitchen/dining area.

Help yourself to milk or cream for your Keurig coffee or tea, preserves, baked goods (both home made or store bought), yogurt, cereals and nut butters.

name: Peaceful Oasis on the Red Line
transit: If you are driving, there is ample free parking on our street.  On Mondays April to November there is parking on one side only for street cleaning; check with us about that.   Boston's transit system is called the MBTA, or "the T" for short.  The Savin Hill stop on the Red Line is right around the corner.   DIRECTIONS:  Take the Red Line to SAVIN HILL. Take the ASHMONT train.  DO NOT take the BRAINTREE train.  Exit the train station to the left.  Take the second right onto TUTTLE STREET.  Sixth house on the left, number 34. FROM THE AIRPORT:  Take the Silver Line.  Then follow the Red Line directions.  It's free!!
access: Use of two shared full baths.  Light use of kitchen, including use of refrigerator, electric kettle, french press, toaster, and toaster oven for re-heating. No cooking. Use of washer and dryer.  You will have a key to the front door.  You can come and go as you please.  There is no curfew.  The room is on the third floor.  There are two flights of stairs.

name: Your own bedroom, sitting room & bathroom. Near T.
transit: Driveway parking available, if you come by car. Public transport:   Orange Line train, and public bike-rental 'hub'  are a block or so away (and Southwest Corridor bike / footpath into town) at Green Street T station; (by train 7- minutes to Northeastern Uni., 12 mins to the Symphony, 15-20 to Downtown.} Also zipcar convenient. From Logan airport: Taxi costs approx $45 plus tip. By public transport: You catch the free shuttle to the Airport Subway Stop where you buy a subway 'Charlie' card with credit/debit card or cash.  Take the Blue Line inbound to State Street stop and change to the Orange Line toward Forest Hills station. Get off at Green Street station. (Regular Subway fare is $2.65 per ride.) (Daily bus/subway pass is $10. A weekly pass is $19--a great deal even for a few days.)  Takes about 40-45 minutes.  Call when you get to Green St station  and I'll direct you to house via a shortcut. If coming by train: Closest Amtrak station is Back Bay which is also on Boston's MBTA Oran

access: You will enter our home through the main front door. If I cannot be here to meet you in person, I will send you the passcode for the front door, so you can check yourself in. However I am always willing to hold your bags in our front foyer until your check in time. Just ask. Once you are in the house, you go all the way up to the third floor landing. There are two doors, to the left is your bedroom, and straight ahead is the rest of the space. It's all for you! In the bedroom there is a double bed, with a nice firm mattress. The other room can be used as a living room to relax and watch TV, or you can also use this as another bedroom. If you are interested in using Boston’s bike sharing system, Hubway, there are stations located up and down Newbury Street, with the closest location on Darmouth Street (5 minute walk). If you are looking for a car service, we recommend downloading the Uber or Lyft app.  10 minute walk to Massachusetts Ave T Station – Orange Line 10 minute walk to Prudential Center 11 minute walk to Boston Public Library 13 minute walk to Symphony T Station – Green Line   13 minute walk to Boston Symphony Hall 13 minute walk to Newbury Street 14 minute walk to Boston Public Garden

name: Minutes From Fenway
Long term great location quiet place
transit: Easy buses to Harvard, Boston University, MIT. "Boston landing" commuter rail stops: Fenway, Back Bay, South Station( Silver line to Airport).  Street parking possible. Buses 66,64, 57 to Harvard, MIT, Boston University. Bicycle is another good option. Buy your Charley card at the airport T-stop (if available) or Harvard T-station. If staying for at least 3 weeks, charge it with monthly pass (bus or combo).  Otherwise, put some money on it right there at the machine. If nobody there, read the options before buying anything. The plastic Charlie card gives you discounts to some stores, and to the MBTA, including one free transfer with every ride. Read about it online before you come. The bus fair is less than train, so when you pay for the bus and transfer to the train, it will add the money difference. Buses are 3-5 min walk away. Look up (URL HIDDEN) (Metro Boston Transport Authority) and use TRIP PLANNER from Hano street. Take pictures of local maps and make them available off line be

name: Lux 1 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WIFI
transit: Most locals get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the  Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority  offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport. Fenway gives you everything you love about city living and with a T-stop right next door, you’ll be free to explore all Boston has to offer with ease.
access: You have access to the entire apartment, and all the fantastic amenities this building offers to its tenants.

name: Save $$, walk to airport & train
transit: The closest T stop (the T is the name of the train system in Boston) is the Airport T stop on the Blue Line. The Blue Line will take you directly downtown if you are ever heading in that direction. If you are arriving from Logan Airport, take their free curbside tram marked with "MBTA Blue Line" from the ground transportation curb to the Airport T stop, and then walk upstairs and across the T terminal out into the park, and then 3 minutes to my front door. This system operates daily from 5 AM until 1 AM. Parking is easy.  You can park across the street from my house in spots reserved for "2 hour visitor parking".  There is a two hour limit Monday-Friday from 9-6, but no one ever patrols this, so the two hour limit doesn't really matter. I even leave my own car there all day!   On nights, and on weekends there is no time limit for parking
access: Two bedrooms with 1 queen and 1 full bed; clean bathroom; full access and use of the kitchen, living room, and back porch; the TV has cable, HBO!

name: Friendly Resting Spot/Great Transit

Multiple buses pick up within a block or two of our house.  We and our guests have also had good success using on-demand ride services like Über or Lyft to get around. Easy access by car or public transit to Boston Logan Airport, Downtown Boston, Fenway Park, and more!
access: In addition to your private bedroom, you will have access to the kitchen, bathroom, dining room, and living room. Please be aware that you will be sharing the apartment with us, so please be courteous in your use of common areas.

Walk to reach Harvard square boarder and school of Government/JFK park 25 minutes, but additional 10 min or so to reach Harvard metro station. Bike is convenient. Ask me for options. access: Space in shared refrigerator, shared microwave (please always use microwave lid to help keep it clean and keep door slightly open after use for ventilation). Please please please do recycling of everything (brown bags provided, everything goes into one bag and when full, put if inside blue plastic container next to the house) DO NOT put any trash into large metal box on the parking lot, it is private property and I can get a fine if somebody reports it. If you do not recycle properly, I will do it for you and charge you $100 per week.

name: 1 Bedroom in large Condominium (II)
transit: Bring your walking shoes!!!  There is a convenient MBTA Silver Line bus stop right on front of the building.  The Silver Line bus is the only bus line that can take you to the airport.  The unit is also at walking distance (15 mins) from Massachussetts Avenue Orange Line and Back Bay Subway Station.  So, bring your walking shoes.  Boston has a great bicycle network.  It is the best way to move around.  Check out the The Hubway ( (Website hidden by Airbnb)  You can rent a bicycle to move around and to get to your destinations easily.  I totally recommend biking than walking.
access: The unit is a street/ground level unit.  Easy access from the front and from the patio on the back.

name: Boston, South End - 1 Bedroom (I)
transit: There is a convenient MBTA Silver Line bus stop right on front of the building.  The Silver Line bus is the only bus line that can take you to the airport.  The unit is also at walking distance from Massachussetts Avenue Orange Line and Back Bay Subway Station.   The City of Boston also has a great bicycle sharing program ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) where you can use a bicycle for a short period of time, a month or a year.  It is very convenient.  It is basically the version of a zipcar but with a bicycle.  There is a station with bicycles ready to be rented a block away from the building.

We also have Mike's in our block which is an excellent breakfast dinner (recommended).  Across the street there is Equator (really good Thai Food) and Seyo (Sushi).   In the next block there is a Seven Eleven, a convenience store, a Walgreens Pharmacy, Flour Bakery & Cafe (recommended) and many other wonderful restaurants at a walking distance.

The Chiswick St stop is right outside the front doorway within viewing of the apartment complex. Bus routes that lead to Boston and Harvard University are also no more then ten to fifteen minutes walking distance away. One parking spot is available for a cost of $15 a night (considering parking costs are about $35 a night for downtown Boston, and the convenience and difficulty in finding parking in this area our parking costs are very reasonable). Please let us know if you need a parking space. I do recommend public transportation for much of you trip's travel.
access: You will have access to all three bedrooms, the cafe and the bathroom. The apartment is on the top floor of the complex. When you arrive there will be fresh linens and towels for your first day of stay with us.  There is a queen size bed in each bedroom.  Two bedrooms have comfortable sofas as well.  Adjoining the third bedroom is a little private television viewing room for you to relax in when you come home. Each bedroom has its own separate Mitsubishi climate control air conditioning system.  The cafe has seating for four, a refrigerator, a washer and dryer, heating stove and small kitchen table along with all necessary utensils.

name: Spacious, modern--right next to T
transit: Train station is two blocks away, so you can be in downtown Boston (Back Bay) in 10 minutes.  FREE parking on the street.
access: Your bedroom will be spacious and includes a King-size comfortable bed, a desk, closet space, and one large drawer. The bathroom is medium-sized with a shower. The kitchen is accessible to guests for storing food  (fridge, freezer)  The living room is large and luminous, followed by a cozy dining room with a vintage-style sound system.

name: HOME @ the Corner of History & Luxury
transit: HUB of it all in Boston. The subway is a 5 minute walk
access: Entire apartment is available to the guest while they stay in Boston's North End.

name: *** Sunny apartment *** near Airport & Train stop
transit: SUPER CONVENIENT - Walk from the airport in only 9 minutes! The Airport T (train) station is a 9 minute walk away and will take you into downtown Boston in just TWO stops (a 6 minute train journey).
access: We have a very flexible 24-hour check in/out process so you can arrive and leave whenever you wish.

name: Harvard Boston University MIT 2A
transit: 3-5 min walk bus stop: 66,64, 57 to Harvard, MIT, Boston University. Bicycle is another good option. Get Charley card at the airport T-stop (if available) or Harvard T-station/ Central square and charge it with money: If staying for at least 3 weeks, charge it with monthly pass (bus or combo). If nobody there, read the options before buying anything. The plastic Charlie card gives you discounts to some stores, and to the MBTA, including one free transfer with every ride. Read about it online before you come. The bus fair is less than train, so when you pay for the bus and transfer to the train, it will add the money difference. Buses are 3-5 min walk away. 66, 64, 57. Please look up Metro Boston Transport Authority and use TRIP PLANNER from Hano street. Take pictures of local maps and make them available off line before you arrive as your phone may not work here or in case there is no internet connection. Consider bike rental idea. Bring backpack and reusable light weight nylon shoppin
access: Microwave for fast warm-ups or "microwave meal" defrost.  Supermarket Stop and Shop that is steps away (in there you find coffee place Dunkin Donuts). Other closest cafe is 4 min walk at Everett st and Cambridge st/N.Beacon st) Please keep your personal items in your room except plates, but as you wish.  If you have dirty plate for hours in your room, cover it with plastic bag tight. Plates, cups, utensils are available for you use on White Rack by the sink. Please use water conservatively. Please don't bring plastic bags from store to use them for trash, we have plenty. Cities in Brookline and Cambridge banned use of single use plastic bags so you will not get them in any store. Reusable fold-able shopping bag provided for you. Shared refrigerator/freezer. Please be considered of the environment and be Earth Friendly. It may seems hard at first, but please think of the benefits for all. We recycle everything, please don't through plastic or food in trash. All food waste can be dispose

Guests are welcome to watch television in the living room or sit back deck for view of the garden.

name: Furnished 2BR Boston Fenway Apt.
transit: These newly constructed, luxury apartments epitomize what it means to live well in one of Boston’s most eclectic and vibrant communities. An established neighborhood standout, the building’s apartments offer floor to ceiling windows with one of the most beautiful views of the Boston skyline. No matter what your preference, you’re within minutes of it all - Back Bay’s trendy shopping centers, Fenway’s endless entertainment, the best restaurants in Boston, and easy access to the Fenway T. The ease that comes with our 24 hour check in and concierge service, parking garage, as well as unparalleled on-site amenities makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

As does the #1 bus, which travels down Massachusetts Avenue to Berklee, MIT and terminates in Harvard Square.  The Orange Line Massachusetts Avenue stop is three blocks from my apartment.

name: Charming Studio in Boston Brownstone, C. Ave #33
transit: Since Boston is widely known as a “walkable city” we recommend walking to your destinations or using our public transportation system “The T”. If you are interested in using Boston’s bike sharing system, Hubway, there are stations located up and down Newbury Street, with the closest location on Darmouth Street (5 minute walk). If you are looking for a car service, we recommend downloading the Uber or Lyft app.  10 minute walk to Massachusetts Ave T Station – Orange Line 10 minute walk to Prudential Center 11 minute walk to Boston Public Library 13 minute walk to Symphony T Station – Green Line   13 minute walk to Boston Symphony Hall 13 minute walk to Newbury Street 14 minute walk to Boston Public Garden
access: Studio has a private bathroom which is located outside the unit, across the hall.  So, one must leave the unit to access the bathroom.  There is an access code on both the unit and bathroom door so, no one else will have access to the bathroom. Wireless internet, set of towels and linens provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils, direct satellite TV, coin-op Laundry in the building. Parking: Public transportation is the suggested form of transportation as it is only less than a 5 minute walk to the Back Bay Station. There is primarily street parking reserved for Boston residents which you need a permit in order to use. Nearby garages:      Prudential Center Garage      800 Boylston Street      Boston, MA       Copley Place Parking      2 Copley Pl, Boston, M (Website hidden by Airbnb) Back Bay Garage       222 Berkeley Street #1420, Boston, MA            Pilgrim Parking - Atelier | 505 Garage      505 Tremont Street, Boston      (Entrance is on Warren Avenue)

name: Entire 2 Bedroom Condo in Boston - Near Subway

There is also a bus stop around the corner that takes you directly to various locations like the Museum of Fine Arts, Elizabeth Gardner Museum, Northeastern University, Boston Public Library, etc.  I can provide direction and suggestions on how to get to various destinations if you are unsure. One of the many reasons why I bought my condo here is the close proximity to downtown Boston but that it also feel like I've gotten away from the urban jungle while running in the Arboretum park or sipping coffee in Cafe Nero.
access: Guests will have access to a modern gourmet kitchen with fully stocked cookware, gas stove, microwave, refrigerator, and dishwasher. It also has a Apple TV device, which provides access to Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, YouTube, HBO Go, etc.  As mentioned throughout, guests will also be able to enjoy their own private patio. There is also a small modern bathroom with an old school latch lock and a claw foot tub.

name: no-frills 3BR steps to airport & train
transit: The closest T stop (the T is the name of the train system in Boston) is the Airport T stop on the Blue Line. The Blue Line will take you directly downtown if you are ever heading in that direction. If you are arriving from Logan Airport, take their free curbside tram marked with "MBTA Blue Line" from the ground transportation curb to the Airport T stop, and then walk upstairs and across the T terminal out into the park, and then 3 minutes to my front door. This system operates daily from 5 AM until 1 AM. Street parking is plentiful and easy.  You can park across the street from my house in spots reserved for "2 hour visitor parking".  There is a two hour limit Monday-Friday from 9-6, but no one ever patrols this, so the two hour limit doesn't really matter. I even leave my own car there all day!   On nights, and on weekends there is no time limit for parking.
access: You will have full use of both spacious bedrooms, each furnished with a queen size luxury pillow-top air mattress and night stand.  Both bedrooms have spacious closets as well.  The flat also has a small office, which can be used as a small third bedroom if necessary.   The bathroom is small, but clean and fully stocked.  The kitchen is brand new, and ready for either milk&cereal or a gourmet chef.  It has stocked cabinets, dishwasher, garbage disposal, coffee maker, granite counters, and an island with stools.  The cozy living room has a nice couch and dining room table as well.  The apartment has a private, safe entrance off the street as well.

As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access that are personalized for your stay. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, we have limited units to shuffle around.

name: Lux 2 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WIFI
transit: Most locals get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport. Fenway gives you everything you love about city living and with a T-stop right next door, you’ll be free to explore all Boston has to offer with ease.

name: An Elegant Condo in Beacon Hill
transit: Foot: Keep in mind you are in an excellent location.  If the weather is nice, I highly recommend walking as much as possible.  The Boston Common, Public Gardens, Charles St, Newbury St, and Boylston St are all within walking distance.  This means excellent dining, shopping, entertainment, and sightseeing are all accessible by foot.  Also, bicycles can be rented and dropped off at kiosks all around the city. PUBLIC TRANSPORT: The closet T station to the Condo is the Charles/MGH (Red Line) station.  You can access the entire city from this subway/bus hub. How to Walk there: A short 4 min [0.25 mi] walk with 1 turn: -Go EAST on Pinckney Street towards Charles Street -Take a LEFT onto Charles St -Travel NORTH on Charles Street and the station will be straight ahead -- PERSONAL CAR: PARKING: Parking can tricky & expensive in Boston. The easiest solutions for first-time travelers are parking garages. The most convenient garage for this location is the Boston Common Parking Garage. The Boston

During the day, you can only park for up to 2 hours per block ($0.25 per 12 minutes).  Please take note of the street cleaning signs and spots that are reserved for residents only.  Your car will be towed by the city if you park during the street cleaning hours. Private parking maybe available behind the building at an additional cost of $35 per day.  We own one spot around the corner and I will park my car on the street or in a nearby garage if you’re interested in renting our spot. name: Beautiful 2BD / 1 BA - 1st Floor

I personally prefer the Commuter Rail, as it is a very relaxing experience on the train compared to a bus. If you have a car, you can park on Temple Street, there are no meters or permits.  Please park as close to  driveway openings as possible, but do not block them.  This will maximize the number of cars that can be parked on the street and is very helpful to the neighbors!

name: Double in Arts & Crafts Bungalow
transit: We're a 10 minute drive from I-95. Free street parking is always available right in front of our house. While we're not near a subway stop, you can hop on the MBTA 38 bus in a quick 3 minute stroll down the block to Park and Woodard Streets, or catch the more frequent 34 and 40 buses in an easy 10 minute walk to the stops at the corner of LaGrange and Washington Streets. In addition, the speedy Boston commuter rail is accessible at the bottom of the hill at the corner of Park and Railroad Streets in a brisk 15 minute hike. See our Guidebook for these public transit stops and then use G00GLE Maps Transit to plan your routes from the corner of Park and Robin Streets. In addition, ride sharing options such as Uber, Lyft, and Fasten are very convenient alternatives, and fairly cost-competitive with public transportation when traveling in a group.
access: Feel comfortable lounging in the living room in front of the fireplace, hanging out on the front porch, and taking a meal or playing a board game at the dining room table. Just ask for a tour of the kitchen if you'd like to prepare a meal or store things in the fridge.

We also have a red sideboard filled with all the glassware and plateware you'll need for a lovely dining experience.   During the warmer months, head one flight up to the fully finished and furnished roof deck for unobstructed views of the city and an impressive gas grill/grill tools.  There are tables and chairs for an evening BBQ.  Help yourself to firewood but please follow instructions when making a fire - the fireplace is open from two sides - to the living room on one side and the dining room on the other - while this is a very special aesthetic, it is is a delicate balance of cross breezes to ensure smoke goes up the flue - (i) dining room door must be open, (ii) all windows and glass door to balcony must be closed - any other combination will result in

name: Gorgeous rowhouse in South End
transit: Our home is conveniently located on a beautiful, tree-lined elbow street.  Parking is for residents only but the street has six visitor spots just a half block away where you can park on weekdays.  Parking is free and open after 8 p.m.  and on weekends. Car rentals are conveniently located just 10 minutes away at Boston's Prudential Center and cabs/Uber are available 24/7. We are just a five minute walk from both the Orange line's Massachusetts Ave stop and the Ruggles stop.  Both of these put you in the center of the city in under 5 minutes.  Conveniently located around the corner is Boston's Hubway (bike sharing) and a beautiful walk up Tremont St. to Boston Common only will take you about 15 minutes.

We do ask that you don't book the room and spend your entire stay in our apartment. We're here to help travelers who want to enjoy our city do so with reasonable costs, but it's really awkward to have someone come and just hang out in our apartment for entire days.  The expectation is that we're providing you a safe place to sleep and store the things you're traveling with, not a place where you will spend large portions of your waking hours.

name: Big, Bright, Boston Brownstone
transit: The St. Mary's T stop is right out front. This is on the Green, C-line, train. There is also a taxi stand across the street. Uber is usually available within 5 minutes, since we are right around the corner from Fenway Park, BU, and other popular spots. You can hop on the train or in a car and be downtown in 10 minutes. There is metered parking out front. The block we are on is Brookline, so you cannot park overnight on the street in front. You can go just down to the next block and park overnight (after the meters finish), on the street, for free, in Boston. There is also an apartment around the corner that offers 24 hours of parking for $10, which is a great option if you wish to park overnight and use public transit. There are also zip cars available in that same garage, just steps from the place.
access: We will provide keys to the front door to the building and our apartment, and you will have access to everything in the place.  We will make space in our closets for you to unpack. Our kitchen is quite equipped and you are welcome to use it. We have all the basics, a few gadgets, and even lots of spices and condiments you can use if you'd like. We will provide fresh sheets and towels, and have the place cleaned for you before and after your stay.

You can walk/stroll on the beautiful trails, take in the rich wildlife, go fishing, kayaking or canoeing, or go picnicking in one of the numerous beautiful parks in Newton. Only a 5-minute walk away are Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Thai, gourmet pizza, and a hip new yoga studio.

name: Lux 1-Bedroom Boston Apartment with Yoga Studio
transit: Make yourself comfortable in one of the many lounges of this building. Linger over a cup of coffee in the beautifully landscaped terrace with friends, watch the last game on TV or buy some tickets for the newest play in town in the fully-wired lounge. You won’t have time to get bored with the fully-equipped state-of-the-art fitness center and with the wide array of entertainment options of the nearby area. This upscale community is located at the confluence of the Theatre District, the Leather District and Chinatown and is near every hot spot in town: from the latest eatery to the most acclaimed play, everything is a few steps away from your door. The open layout apartments are spacious and feature gourmet kitchens with top of the line appliances and granite countertops, ample walk-through closets and oversized windows with gorgeous city views.

name: Boston Newbury Two Bedroom Grand
New Luxury 2-Bedroom Fenway Apt!
transit: These newly constructed, luxury apartments allow our guests to truly enjoy all beauty Boston has to offer. Whether you are admiring the Boston skyline from the expansive windows, stargazing from the Rooftop Lounge, or taking a quick walk past Fenway Park to Kenmore Square, you can’t help but become a part of this eclectic city life. Relatively small in comparison, the building was designed to foster a sense of community - it has a number of public lounges for meeting neighbors and having fun. No matter what your preference, you’re within minutes of it all - Back Bay’s trendy shopping centers, Fenway’s endless entertainment, the best restaurants in Boston, and easy access to the Fenway T. The ease that comes with our 24 hour check in and the professional on-site management team, as well as the unparalleled on-site amenities makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

name: Furnished Luxury 2-BR at West End
transit: The building is located in the center of all of Boston’s most renowned attractions. Just minutes from the Charles River and the Esplanade, Beacon Hill and Boston Common, the North End and the Waterfront, these brand new luxury apartments put you directly in the heart of Boston’s best. For those of you who prefer to stay closer to home, this exclusive community boasts a variety of on-site amenities like basketball and tennis courts, a movie theater, bike & fitness trails, and a private swimming pool. Equally as attractive as its surroundings, our apartments come equipped with oversized windows offering breathtaking views, high ceilings, spacious floor plans, and some of the most well-designed living spaces in Boston. The ease that comes with our 24 hour check in and concierge service, access to parking and public transportation, as well as unparalleled on-site amenities, makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to this beautiful city.

name: Downtown Boston 1BR Apt+ Pool
transit: Formerly known as the Gaiety Theater, The building is located on the site of what was once “Bostons Most Modern Playhouse” dating back to 1908. This newly constructed, eco-friendly 27 floor high-rise is surrounded by beautifully preserved classic theaters like the Boston Opera House and The Paramount. Nestled in the heart of the Theater District and minutes from Downtown Crossing, allows you to travel back to early 20th century Boston by merely stepping outside. Once you open those lobby doors though, you are transported right back to the 21st century. Its contemporary details and design, impressive array of modern amenities, 24 hour concierge, 24 hour check in, and breathtaking views of downtown Boston makes this a truly special vacation experience.

Nestled in the heart of the Theater District and minutes from Downtown Crossing, this property allows you to travel back to early 20th century Boston by merely stepping outside. Once you open those lobby doors though, you are transported right back to the 21st century. Its contemporary details and design, impressive array of modern amenities, 24 hour concierge, 24 hour check in, and breathtaking views of downtown Boston make this property a truly special vacation experience.

name: Furnished 1 Bedroom West End Apartments

It is immediately adjacent to 23 leading medical research and academic institutions and minutes from this beautiful Post-War high-rise. Because this building is located on the Green Line at the Longwood Medical T-stop, you are just a short ride away from The Museum of Fine Arts, Copely Square, and Faneuill Hall. Surrounded by a diverse mix of shopping, a wonderful array of restaurants, and neighboring medical facilities, guests are never far from some of the most exciting and ingenious attractions in Boston. These spacious, pet-friendly apartments feature parquet wood floors, ample closet space and incredible views of the Boston skyline. Along with the outdoor pool, 24-hour concierge service, and fitness center, make this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

From the Bus and Train Terminals (South Station and North Station): Take the metro right at the station you are at and switch to the BLUE LINE to go to the "Blue Line Maverick Station" (In between Downtown and Airport) Uber rides: From all (Airport, Bus, and Train Terminals) Uber rides range from $4 -$6 dollars. Distances in time from and to the Airbnb Hotel: Logan Airport Terminals A,B,C,D,E by Uber 5 minutes South Station by Uber 5 minutes North Station by Uber 5 minutes Logan Airport Terminals A,B,C,D,E by public transportation 10 minutes South Station by public transportation 10 minutes North Station by public transportation 10 minutes Air

access: The entire unit (kitchen, bathroom, living room, bedrooms), and common laundry. Parking is often available on the street during the daytime and weekends, but much more difficult at night and during snow emergencies. Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives me a 4 hour window to have my cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as I have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for my cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, that is not the case here.

name: Cosy Cottage Room on Parker Hill
transit: It is easy to get from our house to most Boston attractions. We are right next to the Baptist Hospital, and within a half hour walk to the Longwood Medical Area (Harvard Medical School, Brigham and Women's, Children's, Beth Israel, and Dana Farber), the Museum of Fine Arts, and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.  Public transport will take you downtown in about half an hour: -5 min walk to the Green “E” line (Heath St. stop) -15 min walk to the Green “D” line (Brookline Village stop) -15 min walk to the Orange line (Roxbury Crossing or Jackson Square stops) -5 min walk to the 39 bus -10 min walk to the 66 bus Uber and Lyft pick up at our house (and we can show you a place to get cheaper prices for Lyft Line). For those with a car, you can park on our street during weekends and nights, but a permit is required for weekday parking. During weekdays, you can park on Parker Hill Ave, Bucknam St, Heath St, or a small portion of Lawn St. If you need help, just ask us.
access: You will have access to all areas in the house except for our bedroom and the attic. You are free to use our fully equipped kitchen, and we’ll provide some fridge space for your food storage. We have a washer and dryer that you are free to use. We do not have a TV, but have a projector and screen in our living room that makes a great spot for watching movies! We can show you how to use the system if you need help.

name: Beacon Hill Townhouse

Short taxi ride [or 20 min walk] to Seaport area with Harbor Walk, Institute of Contemporary Art [ICA], Convention Center, restaurants, boats for harbor tours, Boston Aquarium, Bank of America Pavilion [summer only]. Many published Boston guides available for borrowed use.  Maps galore to assist with tour planning.
access: Entire house is available for use. Plenty of storage space in rooms and in full finished basement. Bikes can be stored in patio with access through alleyway. Fast wireless internet is available throughout house perfect for movie streaming [30Mbps] Central sound system with internet-based controls [6-zone Sonos] so that everyone can bring their own music or other music service, local radio stations, and listen independently.

No matter what your preference, you’re within minutes of it all - Back Bay’s trendy shopping centers, Fenway’s endless entertainment, the best restaurants in Boston, and easy access to the Fenway T. The ease that comes with our 24 hour check in and concierge service, parking garage, as well as unparalleled on-site amenities makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

name: A Suburban Room in Boston
transit: We are on two bus routes which stop within 100 yards of the house and within 1 mile of the T (the name of our subway system). There aren't any buses through our neighborhood on Sundays, but it's a quick 20 minute walk through a park, or a 10 minute Uber/Lyft ride. We do not recommend parking in Boston. In most cases, during the week especially, parking can cost upwards of $40 per day. On street, overnight parking is safe, free and abundant at our home. Please do not park in, or in front of the driveways. GMaps is a fantastic resource for our area. There is NO bus service in our neighborhood on Sundays. Uber has several local drivers that we have used ourselves. They are polite, fast, and less expensive than a taxi.
access: You are more than welcome to join us downstairs.  Watch tv, hang out at the table, or join us in a game of cards.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a kcup coffee maker, electric kettle to heat water, a toaster, and a microwave. And of course a refrigerator if you want to keep something cold. We always have treats to share...fruit, coffee pods, tea bags, and snack. If there's something you want to cook, just let me know and I'll help you get situated (DON'T TOUCH THE CAST IRON PANS...you'll make me cry!) There's cable tv in the living room with Showtime, Starz, BBC America, etc. A DVD player and Chromecast is available as well.* We have plenty of seating. Feel free to join us! *We don't have any gaming systems, but Ingress and Pokemon GO portals are abundant throughout the neighborhood.

All parts of the city can be reached by this transit system as well as the commuter rail that goes from Boston, North to Maine and as far South as to Cape Cod.  We recommend that you download the Uber or Lyft app. and that will make your visit go smoothly.  Taxis can be tough to get at certain times of the day, Uber/Lyft usually has a quick response time, and they tend to be a bit cheaper. Bikes are also available right near our place.

name: Boston -in the center of it ALL!

Everyone is helpful.

If you would like a Charlie Card (for a free bus ride to the area from the airport, and to use the T (our metro) I would be happy to mail that to you. Just let me know!

It's only about 10 min drive from/to the airport. Uber shows $9-12 cost. Make sure to use Charlestown (not Boston) when entering the address in GPS or when you ask the taxi/Uber/Lift driver where to go. If you are driving here from the north or south of Boston, take exit 28 from Route I-93 towards Charlestown/Sullivan Square/Assembly Square, merge onto MA-38 S, take a ramp on the left to Charlestown, Boston, Sullivan Square. Turn right onto Cambridge Street, it's the second house on the right side. If you drive from West of Boston take Mass Pike (Route 90) to exit 24 A-B-C for Interstate 93 N, keep right at the fork to continue to Exit 24B to

Downtown Crossing is home to the historical Freedom Trail, over 100 restaurants, 500 retailers, bars, nightclubs, and different cultural events. Planning to explore Boston or beyond? This fantastic location is just steps from the Orange and Green T-stops, South Station Terminal, I-90, and Logan International Airport. name: Comfy sofa bed right in the Fenway
transit: A lot of Boston's greatest hits are within walking distance. There's a bus (the 55) a block away that can take you downtown to Park Street in 20 minutes. We're about a 10 minute walk from the Kenmore Square T stop (B, C and D line) as well as within walking distance to the Orange Line (Ruggles, Mass Ave) and the E line (Northeastern, MFA, Symphony stops). Uber/lyft/taxis are easy to get here. Many zipcars within walking distance. There is some visitor parking, and metered parking during the day (free overnight) nearby. Note that on Red Sox game days parking can be hard to come by and/or expensive. If it's not a game day, there are some good garage deals (~$10/day for example)
access: You'll have access to our living room and attached kitchen. We'll try to give you as much privacy as possible while you're staying with us, especially at night. We'll need to have access to the kitchen, though. You can feel free to use the kitchen/fridge to store things, cook, etc.

name: One-BR Apt in Heart of Beacon Hill
transit: It is easiest to get around this part of Boston by walking, Uber/Taxi or the T (near MGH Station/Red Line).  If you have a car, there is a small no-parking area on the corner of Myrtle and Grove that is convenient for quick drop-offs at the apartment, however it is a no parking/tow zone - and they do ticket and tow often both around the apartment and in the neighborhood in general.  There is no visitor parking in the Beacon Hill neighborhood outside of metered parking on Charles St, which is extremely difficult to come by.  Longer-term parking can be found in garages outside the Beacon Hill neighborhood in downtown Boston, which is walkable or a short taxi ride.  Hertz car-rental is on Cambridge St (down the street, a five minute walk), and ZipCar has vehicles available in the Charles River Parking Garage behind Au Bon Pain.  Uber is widely used and available, and some taxi numbers will be provided in the welcome pack.

Boston is also host of three different low-cost ride share programs: Lyft, Uber, and Fasten.  Lyft and Uber specifically are always available in this area within a couple minutes.

The closest grocery store is Rosis Market, and nearest coffee shop is Dunkin Donuts. A local favorite for laundry service is The Laundry Room ( (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) .  A short three minute walk will get you to the East Boston Greenway, with many walking and bike paths. Piers Park is also close, with stunning harbor views, a fitness area, playgrounds, and access to a community sailing center.  Via the Blueline, you can be at Faneuil Hall in 9 minutes, or Boston Common in just 14 minutes.

Walking through Jamaica Plain is also very easy and incredibly scenic! The apartment is just a 10 minutes walk from Centre Street with some amazing shops and restaurants to explore.

transit: We are very conveniently located in Boston!  With 2 subway stops (T) only a 6 minute walk from our house (Jackson and Stony Brook) on the Orange Line which goes straight to downtown Boston.  The T is safe and easy to utilize throughout the city and weekly passes are only $19 (this includes subway and local buses).  For more information, check out (URL HIDDEN) Other options are to hop on a Hubway Bike, a shared bike service.  Rates are $5/day for unlimited rides under 30mins.  This is a great way to see the city and you can even ride on the Emerald Necklace greenway that runs through JP all the way to the heart of Boston.  This is our favorite way to get around! Airport is ~50min via T (blue line and orange line) or ~20min via Taxi/Uber There is also FREE parking on our street, no permit or sticker required (*from April-Nov, be aware of street cleaning signs and park accordingly. Not doing so could result in ticket and tow.)
access: Please fully enjoy every aspect and space of our home.  In the master bedroom, the top three drawers will be available (in the second bedroom, all of the drawers) as well as some space and hangers in the two bedroom closets.  Bathrooms and fresh towels will be available to you as well as more fresh towels in the main bathroom should you need them.   Also available to our guests is free and easily accessible parking on the street outside our home, and the usage of the in-unit washer and dryer and entire kitchen. In nice weather, please enjoy the front and back porches (although we ask that there is no grilling on these porches during your stay:)

PARKING: PARKING: As far as parking, there are several options.  1) There is metered parking, which turn off at 6pm or 8pm (I believe different parts of town have different "off-meter" times), and turn back on at 7am or 8am the following day. Sat and Sun are free.  2) There are side streets which have non-metered parking.  3) Just a few minutes way, in opposite directions, are the Boston Commons  and Government Center Parking Garages.   BOSTON COMMONS PARKING OPTIONS Enter between 6am and 4pm $12 - Up to 1 hr $18 - Up to 2 hrs $24 - Up to 3 hrs $28 - Up to 10 hrs $32 - Maximum charge for 24 hours Evening rate: Enter between 4pm and 6am and exit before 8am - pay just $10 for up to 1 hour, $14 for 1-3 hours, and $18 (up to 8am) for 3 hours or more. Weekend rates:   Enter after 6am on Saturday or Sunday and exit by 8am on the following morning $10 - Up to 1 hour $14 - 1-3 hours $18 - Over 3 hours (up to 8am) GOVERNMENT CENTER PARKING OPTIONS 20 mins

It is a green house with a lot of parking in front of it (Green Honda Accord, Green Mitsubishi Montero Sport, and White Chevy Cobalt will also be parked there -- in addition there is also a basketball hoop in the parking lot).  Next to the parking you will also see an utility pole with the Overlook Road Street sign.   After parking, you will see a big pine fir, gravel parking, a lawn and a stack of firewood to the far right.  Walk behind the pine fir, follow the brick walkway and you will find a pair of lit up stairs. Climb the stairs to get to the apartment.

And there is a good public transportation system.    The apartment is near three "T" stops:  Prudential/green/8 min walk,  backbay/orange/12 min and Mass Ave/orange/8min (the T is our metro, which is also called the MTA).  At one end of my street the 43 bus goes downtown and to Beacon Hill in about 12-15 min.  At the other end of the street the Silver Line (also a bus) goes to downtown, South Station and, with a transfer, to the airport.   The other main train station, back bay, is a 12-15 min walk or you can take a taxi.downtown.  You can take the silver line from the airport to the apartment with a switch at south station.

transit: Both the Community College and Sullivan Square T stations are about a half mile’s walk away from the house.  Both are on the Orange Line; Community College is recommended if heading into downtown. Single day and 7-day passes (CharlieTicket/CharlieCard) for the transit system (MBTA, called “The T” by locals) are available at most stations and run about $12/day or $21/week per person.  They allow unlimited rides on the T trains and buses in the core Boston Metro area (not commuter lines).  Single use tickets or stored value tickets for multiple rides can also be purchased.  The 92 bus is a minute’s walk away on Main St. while the 89/93 bus can be reached on Bunker Hill St., about 2-3 minutes by foot. Uber is quite popular in Boston and is often used to fill in where the T doesn’t reach conveniently or for late nights out.  A free first ride can likely be arranged for those without an existing Uber account. The Charlestown Ferry is another way to both get around and get to know Boston.  D

transit: You don't need a car if you're staying here, as the T (subway) will take you everywhere you need to go in Boston and Cambridge.  In fact, I'd recommend you not bring a car if you can help it - it will just be a hassle here in Boston. The apartment is one block from the T.  The closest stop is Griggs Street on the B line, and the train takes you right through the middle of Boston in about 30 to 45 minutes.  Geographically, we are only 3 miles (5 km) from Copley (the center of Boston).  The T moves slowly, though, and thus the trip into town feels longer. Taxis and Ubers/Lyfts are easy to find in Allston. For parking: there is street parking, not the easiest to find but not impossible.

name: Most Convenient Location in Boston
transit: The location cannot be better for travelers.  You can pretty much walk to any location in downtown, the financial district, Seaport, Beacon Hill, North End, and Back Bay within 20 minutes.  If you need to go further, all the major subway lines are within 3-7 minutes walk.  If you are attending a conference at the Boston Exhibition Center, it is a 20-minutes walk down Summer Street.  The Logan Airport is about 15-20 minutes away by the Silver Line subway.  Cambridge and Kendall Square is 10-15 minutes away by Red Line subway.   If you need parking for longer distance travel, there are more than five garage to choose from.  The cheapest option is the Pilgrim parking garage on Beach Street.  It costs $17 for weekday early bird special, $13 overnight, and $18 for a 24-hr parking over the weekend.

There are Zipcars and Hubway bicycles in the area plus a water taxi.   Bus 93 is the main bus line services the area and gets you to the Orange and Green lines in about 5-10 minutes for fast access to other areas of Boston and Cambridge.   Boston is also a big Uber and Lyft town so there is always a ride available at a reasonable price except during rush hours of 8-10am and 4-7pm.

Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have my cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. It's only about 10 min drive from/to the airport. Uber shows $9-12 cost. If you are driving here from the north or south of Boston, take exit 28 from Route I-93 towards Charlestown/Sullivan Square/Assembly Square, merge onto MA-38 S, take a ramp on the left to Charlestown, Boston, Sullivan Square. Turn right onto Cambridge Street, it's the second house on the right side. If you drive from West of Boston take Mass Pike (Route 90) to exit 24 A-B-C for Interstate 93 N, keep right at the fork to continue to Exit 24B towards I-93N, take exit 28 from Route I-93 towards Charlestown/Sullivan Square/Assembly Square, merge onto MA-38 S, take a ramp on

transit: It's a short walk to many tourist sites, restaurants and the "T" at Haymarket. ~~ Parking in the North End of Boston ~~ 1.The best place to park without paying is in a visitors’ lot on Hanover Street. Pay attention to the signs because some are from 8am-6pm and some are 12pm –6pm. Free parking is limited usually to two hours and is often enforced. 2.Metered parking is usually available all along Commercial Street, which runs perpendicular to Hanover Street. Bring plenty of quarters. 3.For overnight parking, I recommend parking in the Sargent’s Wharf on Commercial Street, right next to Starbucks. The cost for overnight parking runs between $9 and $14, but be sure to check the rate schedule, because the rate may change for the daytime. For overnight parking on the street, most parking spaces are reserved for residents or valet parking zones. 4.There is also an indoor garage near the Fleet center called the North End Garage. 5.Meter maids are notorious in the North End. They love it becau

name: One Private Colorful Room in Jamaica Plain.

The T is comprised of commuter trains  which is the Purple Line,subway trains that are the Orange, Red, Blue, Green, Lines. There is a Silver Line but it is a bus. The Stoney Brook  T Station on the Orange Line is a  minute walk from my front door. There are also Uber,Taxis and some bike rental available in the neighborhood.

transit: The apartment is located just outside of Kenmore Square.  Public transportation (both station and train) are just 2 short blocks away. Parking: Parking in the neighborhood is metered 8am-6pm, Monday-Saturday.  Parking in the evening and on Sunday is free.  Meters are typically 1.25/hour and can be paid in my neighborhood via coin, credit card or the BostonPark App (which I highly recommend).  Typically parking is easily accessible on the same block or nearby the apartment with the exception of 2 hours before and during a Red Sox game.
access: I am flexible with arrival and departure times, please just let me know.   Guests have access to the entire apartment during their stay.  I will not be home during your visit, but available via phone/text should you need anything.  The bedroom you sleep in is the guest room, so you have access to a clean, rarely lived in space during your stay. Secure key location in lock-box on premises make check-in/check-out easy.  Code to lock-box provided prior to arrival.

The garage is about a 10 minute walk away...if that.  Close and is the most reasonable option in the area.  check this site out for more parking information: (URL HIDDEN) It can be tricky to find parking in Boston, but not if you use Parkopedia! transit: South Station is 1 block away. Walking distance to all subway ("T") lines. Short walk to the Financial District, Seaport, Boston Common, Chinatown. Of course there is Uber and Lyft, but if you still love traditional taxi cabs, there is a 24-hour taxi stand 1 block away at South Station. Oh, free Silver Line T bus from the airport to South Station - so it's free to get to the loft from Logan!
access: This is downtown loft living as authentic as it gets. Enjoy the wonderful roof deck, just be careful, please. The room you are renting is the former darkroom from the painter/photographer who originally built out the space, converted into a bedroom. There is a queen size bed, and please note that on each side there are a couple of steps up to get up to its elevated platform. The room is amazing for sleeping, and watching TV/movies. But it's quite small, so it's not good for sitting. And since it's a former darkroom, there are no windows, and it's not good for enjoying the great natural sunlight the loft gets. So, guests are welcome to use the shared open loft space and its various "rooms" (mentioned previously). The loft is the penthouse unit on top floor of the building, so it's 5 long flights of stairs, and there is no elevator. So, be ready for your exercise! If you really dislike stairs, then this is not the best apartment for you. And while the original wood floors are beautiful,

transit: The silver line is one block away and connects you to any line of the MBTA.  Or the orange line is a short .5 mile walk away.  The number 1 bus travels to Cambridge and has a limited stop option.  The real time schedules are all available on the nextbus website. If you have a car with you, there is a paid parking lot 1 block away.   Free parking: if you park on Shawmut Ave, which is 2 blocks away, between Massachusetts ave and Melnea Cass Blvd, it is free parking, just be careful of street cleaning signs as the city does tow and ticket.  Also there is free parking after 8pm on Harrison Ave, between Northampton and East Lennox Streets, near the CVS block from 8pm-8am weekdays and free all weekend. But at all other times, it's resident parking only.  You also need to be careful of street cleaning here as the city does ticket and tow.

name: Cosy couch available 5 min away from Airport
transit: The Wood Island train station is at 3 min walk. Most importantly, getting around in Boston via public transit is fairly easy. This location is 5 minutes away from the Airport Station, 15 minutes away from Downtown Boston.  You can also use cab services or ride sharing apps, and a fare to downtown should revolve around $15 (+/- $5 depending on traffic). Downton Boston offers most of the city's historic attractions as well as fine Italian dining in the North End and great restaurants, bars and Irish pubs in the Faneuil Hall). From downtown, most other sides of Boston such as Beacon Hill, Copley, Newberry Street, South End, Financial District, Seaport District, Cambridge, Allston, Charlestown, Chelsea, Revere Beach, Fenway,  Somerville, Malden, Quincy... are just few stops away on the train and/or usually in walking distance.

It's $6 for a 24 hour pass or $12 for a 72 hour pass. The best part is the bikes can be rented and returned to and from the different stations around the city. Check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) for up to the date info. -Uber and Lyft are a very common way for locals and travelers to get around. There are flat rates, no tipping, and a convenient app. -If you drove, there are several Parking Garages nearby. One of the closest is Hynes Auditorium Garage, 50 Dalton Street. It's open 24 hours. We are walking distance to BC, Chestnut Hill Reservoir, St. Elizabeth Hospital, Whole Foods and the YMCA. There are variety of restaurants, cafes and bars in the area (Cleveland Circle, Harvard St in Allston and all the way down Commonwealth Ave and to the heart of Boston). Public Transportation is available going toward Downtown, Copley Square (Fenway Park/Duck Boats), Kenmore Square (Boston Public Garden/Freedom Trail), Harvard University and MIT. Running/Biking Trails are just a couple minutes walk.There are city bike rentals all over the city, where you can rent a bike and return it to a different location. The nearest location is just a few minutes walk down Washington Street. This is a great way to get around and see the city very inexpensively, and get some exercise, too!

name: BEAUTIFUL BEACON HILL 2 BEDROOM!
transit: Public Transit is very close and convenient – Red line (Charles/MGH is 6min walk, Park St 10min), Green line (Arlington 9min, Boylston 9min, Park St 10min). We are only a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport (around $25) or about a 35 minute ride by public transportation ($2.75/person). Street parking in the city is mostly residential with some metered parking. In Beacon Hill there is metered parking on Charles St, Cambridge St, and Beacon St, which run from 8AM-8PM and is free overnight, all-day Sunday, and on holidays. There are also parking garages available. Below is a list of the closet garages to our place in order of distance and their 24 hour parking rates. The top one is the closest to our place, only a 3 minute walk, but all are within a 10 minute walk. The rates are lower for less than 24 hours.  Boston Common Garage: Zero Charles St ($32) Charles Street Parking Garage: 144 Charles St ($42) LAZ Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary: 327 Cambridge St ($35) Standard Charles Rive

name: LOCATION!!Private Room, Parking, 5 minutes from T

It will take you about 15 minutes to get to the downtown area of Boston (ex: 15 minutes to Back Bay train station; 25 minutes to Boston's Government Center; 45 minutes to Logan Airport). Uber and Lyft rides to much of downtown Boston can be had for around $15 depending on traffic and the time requested. We are also located within a 5 minute walk from JP's Centre Street and within a 10 minute walk from almost everything you might need during your stay including grocery stores, ice-cream and coffee shops, bakeries, beer/wine stores, one off stores and restaurants.  A favorite designation of many visitors to Boston is the original Sam Adams brewery (only 10 minutes walk from our location).

transit: Walking to the T is very easy!  RED LINE The red line at Charles/MGH is just a 5 minute walk - head down the hill, take a right onto West Cedar Street. Follow to Cambridge Street - the station is on your left. RED & GREEN LINE Park Street station has both red and green line access. Go up the hill, a right out of the building. Right on Joy, left on Beacon - you can walk through the Boston Common or take a right on Park Street, station is at the bottom of the hill.  BLUE LINE The blue line is less frequently used, but it is the line used to get to Logan Airport! Bowdoin Station is just 9 minutes from the building. Take a right out of the building, a left onto Anderson, then right onto Myrtle. When Myrtle ends, left onto Bowdoin Street. Bowdoin Station will be on Cambridge Street - to your right. ORANGE LINE Closest stop is Downtown Crossing, a 10 minute walk. Take a right out of the building, up the hill. Take a right onto Joy Street. Walk through the Common on the Freedom Trail and once

The city in general is very walkable, but especially from this location. Beacon Hill is less than a 15 minute walk away and so is Fanueil Hall. Charlestown, Seaport, and Back Bay are 20mins walking. There are also Hubway bike rentals nearby!

You can go to the Charles for a run or Tremont street to eat at some of the best restaurants in Boston, without having to go far! There is also Hubway (bicycle sharing) two blocks from the house in case you'd like to rent a bike. I can provide helmets :-) Parking: The house is in the heart of the city so a lot of the parking around the apartment is permit parking. However, if you’d like to drive – experience what it takes to be a New England driver, here are some places you can park your car:  1) There are metered parking available on Charles street and they will become FREE overnight parking from 8pm to 8am (with the exceptions of street cleaning days). During the day, you can park for up to 2 hours on the street.  2) Parking garages are easily found in the neighborhood, for example: Charles St. Parking Garage. If you have to have a car the best bet is to download an app like SpotHero and park your car in the cheapest lot for the duration of your stay. The Duck Boat tours are a great (and very funny) way to see Boston - no I don't get a commission, but I should!

There's free parking in the school lot next door to the house on weekends and Summer holidays. There are metered street parking a block away on Tremont St and Washington St. Valet parking is available a few blocks south at Boston Medical Center for $12 per day. Hubway bikes are available 2 blocks away. Average Uber pick up time is 3 minutes from when you call for it.

Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access that are personalized for your stay. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, we have limited units to shuffle around.

name: Boston - Beacon Hill Apartment
Stayloom's Downtown Destination | near Back Bay
transit: While the neighborhood offers plenty to do and see on foot, there are a variety of convenient, reliable, and affordable transportation options available for those looking to venture out further. Our apartment is less than a minute’s walk away from Back Bay Station, a six minute ride to Downtown Crossing. The Downtown Crossing station is a central meeting point for several train lines, making the whole city readily accessible within minutes.  There are also Hubway bike rental locations scattered throughout the neighborhood. There are also several private transportation options at your disposal (Uber, Zipcar). If you do plan on driving, please note that on-street parking is notoriously tricky in Boston, especially in the winter months! Our apartment does not include off-street parking; there are, however, several parking garages within walking distance.

transit: Close to Logan Airport 8-minute walk to the Train (Blue line) OR get to Downtown Boston (via 120 bus to Maverick Square train stop)  Map in the pictures section Downtown from Maverick square train station is 5 min If you download the Uber and Lyft apps Boston, Cambridge and Somerville all 10 minutes away!
access: You have access to a shared full kitchen, Shared living room, Shared dining area and Shared bathroom (all on the third floor). Wireless access throughout the house. Instant coffee and tea available. After you enter the house, you will climb a set of stairs then take off your shoes. Open the second door to the unit and your room will be on that floor and the Shared spaces will be on the third floor up another set of stairs. Note as typical of homes in Boston the hallways and stairs are narrow. PLEASE NOTE there are TWO other rooms in my home that are typically rented on Airbnb. One on the same floor and the other on the third floor.

name: Private room near Airport and Downtown
transit: Our house is a five minute walk from the subway, and 10 minutes from downtown Boston or Logan airport. There are beautiful places to visit, both North, East, and South of the City - consider taking a boat ride to explore the Boston Harbor Islands.  In the warmer months, there are several HubWay bike rental stations near by, and a wonderful park system that is worth exploring. Take a bike ride to Constitution Beach, or check out a free concert in Piers Park.    Street parking is usually pretty easy to find, but pay close attention to street sweeping signs, as Boston is notorious for towing.
access: You will have a private bedroom. The bathroom is shared with one additional house mate. If you want to use the kitchen, please ask and we can make arrangements.

name: (3a) Private Room for Long-Term Guests by CfSI
transit: It takes no more than a 2-minute walk to catch either the 57 (Kenmore/Watertown Yard), 57A (Kenmore), or 66 (Dudley via Harvard) buses from the apartment. The Harvard Ave. stop on the B branch of the Green line is 5-minutes away on foot. You couldn't ask for a more accessible location.
access: Guests have access to all common areas. The kitchen, patio, living room and dining room and either of the 2 bathrooms.

name: Corporate studio near the State House, Beacon Hill
transit: Close to the orange line - state street , Government Center, haymarket  Red line - park st, Downtown Crossing, MGMH  Green line - Park st, Boylston and Government Center
access: Everything in the unit and the laundry in the basement

name: 5 bedroom- big yard- 15 min to Boston-Rosi Square
transit: The commuter rail stop called Roslindale Village (Needham line) is a 7 minute walk. There is also a bus stop 3 blocks away if you want to take the bus to the subway (Orange line stop called Forest Hills). Free parking at my house in driveway or on street is safe also.
access: Guests have the entire two floors and access to the yard. For long stays you'll be allowed to use the washer and dryer which are in the basement.

name: Modern 1BR in Beacon Hill steps from everything
transit: Less than a 5 minute walk to the Charles MGH redline station. Parking options: garages within a 3-5 minute walk from the apartment range in price from $25/55 a night (via the app parking hero). There is metered street parking 1-block away. On Sunday you can park on the streets in our neighborhood without a pass. Unfortunately the city of Boston does not offer visitors passes because there is limited parking available in the city.
access: Private bedroom. There is a shared living room, kitchen, and bathroom.

name: Bright and welcoming condo in Boston!
transit: Street parking available on the weekends. Generally there is a spot available very close to front door!

name: Sunny room with AC
Lux 2 Bedroom near Charles St w/gym & WiFi
transit: In Boston, most locals get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport.
access: You have access to the entire apartment, and all the fantastic amenities this building offers to its tenants.

name: Bluebird Kenmore Sq 1Bed Apt + Salt Water Pool
transit: This property is conveniently located 15 minutes from General Edward Lawrence Logan International Airport.  Boston is America’s Walking City so public transportation is also easily accessible – just a short walk to Fenway and Kenmore Stations and the Yawkey and Ruggles Commuter Rails.

name: Bluebird Kenmore Sq 1 BR with In-Building Dining!
transit: This property is conveniently located 15 minutes from General Edward Lawrence Logan International Airport.  Boston is America’s Walking City so public transportation is also easily accessible – just a short walk to Fenway and Kenmore Stations and the Yawkey and Ruggles Commuter Rails.

name: Perfectly Located 3 BR the North End by Domio
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just five hours?  Want to give your feet a rest?  Take the "T" or download the Lyft app.  Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
