access: Shared kitchen living room dining room. Large hot tub, Exercise bikes and deck.

name: Spacious Condo with Patio near BCEC!
transit: Southie is a short Uber or bus ride from downtown Boston, Back Bay, the South End, the North End, and all the tourist sites! We are also 21 minutes walking or 7 minutes driving from the BCEC.  The #11 bus, right outside the door, can take you directly to Downtown Crossing via Broadway station (the entry to Southie with many restaurants) and our delicious Chinatown. The #9 bus, which is a 4 minute walk away, can take you to Copley Square in Back Bay, which is an awesome area with restaurants, a huge mall, and Newbury St for shopping.
access: Guests can access the entire condo, including the 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room and kitchen, porch, and patio.

name: Spacious Modern 1 Bedroom/Kitchen
transit: Airport MBTA train station is a 4 minute walk away. There are two bus stops directly in front of the apartment. (120 Bus to Orient Heights/Maverick) Downtown Boston is a $7 uber ride/8 minute drive/ 3 train stops away.
access: Access to a fully furnished kitchen. (Pots/pans/dinnerware) Washer and dryer unit. (No detergent provided) Two televisions. (1 in the living room and 1 in the bedroom) Back door patio

name: Jamaica Plain Quality & Boston Proximity-Sleeps 6
transit: Steps away from Stony Brooke T (subway) station, which will take you in minutes anywhere in Boston and the surrounding towns.
access: This private apartment offers a washer and dryer, available for use, as well as street parking, during the day and over night.

name: Single Family Home in Charlestown
Master Suite in a Victorian Mansion
transit: My house is a few minutes walk from the Ashmont T stop (my street is Alban St). The T is the best way to get around. Here are travel times by subway to a handful of landmarks to get you started: UMass Boston - 11 minutes; Downtown Boston - 18 minutes; Charles River / Mass General - 21 minutes; MIT / Kendall - 24 minutes; Harvard - 32 minutes. Easy access to 93 takes you to the Mass Pike (90) and the airport. Also, an Uber to/from the airport is 15-20 minutes. Using Uber Pool makes it very cheap.
access: You'll have access to the chef's kitchen for basic use and a sitting room where you can relax or get to know other guests in the house.

name: Andrew Sq Teal Room Close to T & Shops
Cozy Home in Boston (Roslindale) Next to Arboretum
HUGE 3000+ sqft Home in Boston
transit: Plenty of on street parking with no restrictions.  On major bus line.  Subway is 2 miles away and is a nice walk through the Arnold Arboretum or about 10 minutes by bus. The Needham line commuter rail is about a 7-8 minute walk from the house.  It runs on a set schedule Monday through Saturday.  Cab/Uber/Lyft rides from the city center approximately $12-25.

name: Open and friendly place in Jamaica Plain
transit: From Logan Airport for Free: Take Silver line (bus) from the Logan Airport to South Station, there you need to switch to Red line and get out on stop named Downtown Crossing. There you switch last time on to Orange line going to Jackson Square.  From Jackson Square stop you walk up the hill, turning Right out the station till you get to Sunnyside Street. It is a L shaped street. House is on third right after you turn left following Sunnyside.  Once you here, there is a drive share car from Getaround.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: There is a nice porch in front to have look at rising or setting sun.

name: Private Room in Charlestown near Bunker Hill
transit: Half a mile from the "Community College," Orange Line, T stop (our public transit). Follow the Freedom Trail from the Bunker Hill Monument to downtown Boston for a scenic walk. Uber and Lyft are easy and widely available. Most rides within 3 miles are about  ten dollars.  A Lyft to the airport is about fifteen USD.
access: Private room, with shared hallway, bathroom, and shared kitchen.

name: Entire floor, private bath, 2 mins walk to subway
transit: Public transportation is very close.  Ashmont train (T) station abuts the rear of the property and is one short block walk away.
access: This is a single family residence with a single front door which everyone uses. Stairs lead to the third floor. Guests have access to third floor only.

name: Private & serene getaway w/ driveway parking!
transit: You can park in our driveway except in the winter but there's always plenty of free parking on our street: no need for a sticker or permit. We are a few blocks from the bus to the medical area and Back Bay Station. We're a 15 minute walk to the Orange Line T (Forest Hills or Green Street) which will connect you with all of Boston and/or Cambridge. It's also a very walkable part of town! We're close to the Longwood Medical area; some of our neighbors who work there walk or bike to work. If you are visiting without a car I'm happy to take you along to the grocery store if you need to get some shopping done or you can get there on your own by bus or walking.
access: You have the entire 3rd floor to yourselves! We renovated the attic this past year following all the City of Boston Building Codes. You have a separate entrance from the back porch and do not have to go through our living space to get to yours. You can park in our driveway in every season but winter when we use the parking space. There are always many parking spaces open on our street which is completely uncharacteristic for most of Jamaica Plain and Boston. No permit required. If you stay for more than a week I can do laundry for you for a small fee.

name: Charming, completely renovated 2bed
transit: 5mins walk to Orange Line (Forrest Hills) with excellent connections to the rest of the metropolitan area.  There is plenty of parking available on the street, no permits required.
access: There is a portable type closet available in the main bedroom for guests to use during their stay. Guests are free to use the kitchen and there will be some free space in the fridge.

name: (384-52) Beautiful One Bed, Comm Ave
transit: Green line T,, Hynes Station, one block away!
access: Lock Box - Code will be released 24hrs before check-in.

name: The Tranquility Room
transit: Bus service is available at the end of the street to Harvard Square.  Uber/taxi ride takes about 10 - 15 minutes to be in downtown Boston. Uber/Taxi Ride times: Harvard Square - 6 minutes Airport - 14 minutes Fenway Park - Red Sox - 12 minutes Downtown Boston - 14 minutes Harvard Square - 5 minutes Aquarium - 15 minutes North End (Italian district) - 16 minutes Boston Common Park - 14 minutes John Hancock Statue Harvard Square - 6 minutes Kenmore Square - 12 minutes Allston Restaurant Row - 8 minutes South Boston Seaport District - 12 minutes Charlestown Navy Yard - 20 minutes Museum of Science (Cambridge) 17 Minutes
access: Guest have access to their private room as well as full access to a shared bathroom, living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry room, and outdoor space. Basically everything is at your disposal! Please note that there are a total of 4 other bedrooms that may be rented out during your stay so please be comfortable with and considerate of the other guests.

name: Perfect 1BR apt S End/B Bay border - Copley Sq
transit: Boston is a very foot-friendly town. The "T" is a block away, along with Hubway bicycles (bike share). And, there's always Uber, Lyft or Taxis.
access: The entire apartment with a full kitchen and private washer & dryer is exclusively for your enjoyment.  This quaint Victorian-Era row house contains 3 apartments, 2 of which are occupied by year-round residents. Located in the most convenient and lovely upscale neighborhood in Boston.

name: Newly Renovated 3 Bedroom, Easy Access to Fenway!
transit: Brighton is accessible via the "B" Branch of the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority (MBTA)'s Green Line light rail service, which has 11 stops along Commonwealth Avenue in Brighton. Cleveland Circle on the "C" Branch is located in the southern tip of Brighton, and the "D" Branch is nearby. Brighton is also served by several local and inner express MBTA Bus routes: •	57 Watertown Yard – Kenmore Station via Newton Corner & Brighton Center •	64 Oak Square – University Park, Cambridge or Kendall/MIT via North Beacon St. •	65 Brighton Center – Kenmore Station via Washington Street, Brookline Village & Brookline Avenue •	66 Harvard Square – Dudley Station via Allston & Brookline Village •	70 and 70A Cedarwood, North Waltham or Watertown Square – University Park via Central Square, Cambridge, Arsenal Street & Western Avenue •	86 Sullivan Square Station – Reservoir (Cleveland Circle) via Harvard/Johnston Gate •	501 Brighton Center – Downtown via Oak Square & Mass. Turnpike (express bus
access: Lock box on site for quick access.  Several company contacts in area to fulfill requests.

name: Room for up to 4 in Updated 1 BR apt by T!
transit: Our subway, affectionately referred to as the T, makes getting around Boston and Cambridge easy without battling for that rare parking space. The house is less than a 5 min walk from the nearest station. 3 stops get you to posh Back Bay, 6 to downtown.  One can walk to the Longwood Medical Area, Northeastern or MFA in 20 minutes or less. Fenway is about a half hour on foot depending on your pace or a very inexpensive uber ride.  For those traveling by car, you can park overnight or 2 hours during the day steps away from the house. Longer daytime parking is about 200 feet away.
access: Gas range Coffee maker Microwave Toaster Dishwasher Disposal Iron/board Wifi

name: Keyless Entry 3 Bedroom in Historic Mission Hill
transit: Steps away from public transit (orange line and bus). Uber and cabs are available. Unit comes with one off-street parking spot.

name: Cozy home,easy access to Downtown&Longwood Medical
transit: By car: 12 minutes to downtown Boston, 15 minutes  to Boston Convention & Exhibition Center, 18minutes to Boston Logan Airport, 20min to Longwood Medical Center (not rush hours). By train: From my house, it will only take you 12minutes walk to JFK Station. From here, you can access to Umass Boston, John Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum (Free bus), Downtown Boston (10mins to Downtown Crossing station with 3 stops away) Boston Convention & Exhibition Center or Boston Logan Airport (get off at stop 3rd - South Station,then take silver line. Approximate 25 to 30mns).  By bus: Bus stop for Bus 18 is few houses away. Bus stop for Bus 8 and 41 is 7min walk from the house. They will take about 20 - 25min to Ruggles Station (orange line), NorthEastern Uni, and Boston Medical Center, Longwood Medical Center.

name: TheLedderhouse5-2Beds 4mto DW/BCEC stepstoT freepk
transit: There is 24 street parking in front of the house, no meter to feed. From Logan airport the easiest way is to take a taxi, Uber or lyft and it will take you 15-20 minutes with no traffic . You could also take free silver line bus to south station, then switch to the Red line. Hop on the red line to Ashmont, stop at Savin Hill station. Then walk 12 minutes to the address .  If you are commuting via transportation there are buses #15 and 17 in front of the building. Also you can walk 12 minutes to Savin hill station to hop on the red line and go anywhere.  The train takes 10 minutes to downtown and 5 minutes to Jfk/Umass Station. Redline is the most convenient line in Boston subway. It connects Savin Hill to South Station, Downtown, Park Street, MGH Hospital, MIT, Havard Square,etc. Beach at 8 minutes away. We are 3 miles from the city. South Bay center and Dorchester Brewing at 5 minute away. Enjoy the free wifi and quiet setting.
access: Guests have access to the fully equipped kitchen, two bathrooms. Also the balcony and patio. Enjoy the backyard area with an outdoor barbecue grill.  Enjoy free coffee at your convenience. There are 24 hour free street parking. You have access to the porch and backyard.

name: Convention Center/Downtown/Subway 1 bed 287-1A
transit: It's walking distance (10 mins) from 2 red-line subways that will take you to downtown Boston and Cambridge. There is also a bus stop right out front. See the HOUSE MANUAL for parking tips. There is also Uber that can pickup/dropoff for inexpensive to downtown Boston. Approx $10 Uber ride to the Boston Convention Center (BCEC), or approx 30 minute walk.
access: The entire unit (kitchen, bathroom, living room, both bedrooms), and common coin-op laundry. Parking is on available the street (visitors OK) - see note on parking. Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access that are personalized for your stay. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, we have limited units to shuffle around.

Both Andrew Station and JFK Station are on the red line which will connect you to all other train lines to get around Boston.

name: ❤️ AIRBNB HOTEL #8
transit: Below are the directions from all the access points of the city. From the Airport: Take the FREE shuttle bus from any terminal to the "Blue Line Airport Station" Then either: Walk for 10 minutes to the Airbnb Hotel OR take the metro direction "Bowdoin" for only ONE STOP and get off at "Maverick Station" Then walk for a minute to the Airbnb Hotel. From the Bus and Train Terminals (South Station and North Station): Take the metro right at the station you are at and switch to the BLUE LINE to go to the "Blue Line Maverick Station" (In between Downtown and Airport) Uber rides: From all (Airport, Bus, and Train Terminals) Uber rides range from $4 -$6 dollars. Distances in time from and to the Airbnb Hotel: Logan Airport Terminals A,B,C,D,E by Uber 5 minutes South Station by Uber 5 minutes North Station by Uber 5 minutes Logan Airport Terminals A,B,C,D,E by public transportation 10 minutes South Station by public transportation 10 minutes North Station by public transportation 10 minutes Air
access: You may use the facilities prior to check-in (12:00pm) and drop off your luggage in the storage area. You may use the facilities after check-out (11:00am) and leave your luggage in the storage area.

name: Lux 1 Bedroom near Charles St w/gym & WiFi
transit: In Boston, most locals get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport.

name: Amazing apartment, Great Location
Sunny Spacious South End 2 Bedroom!
transit: This neighborhood rates a 100 score for travel.  The Orange line is just few minute walk away and from the Train you can get anywhere you want to go. The Ruggles T stations is also just down the street. The walkability score is 96!  You really can walk anywhere from here, and there are literally 4 restaurants within a block away.  I'd like to note that you can walk to the Boston Marathon finish line and all of the pre marathon activities in about. 15 minutes. Driving access is also great if you happen to be driving into the city.  Both the Massachusetts Turnpike and route 93 are just a few minutes drive away.  You won't have to deal with battling traffic to get across the city.  There are a couple of garages not far away but overnight and weekend street parking are free.  Just be careful to read the signs for street cleaning times.
access: The whole apartment will be yours.  I can meet you for check in if you want and then ask you to leave the keys in my lock box outside when your trip is over.  Just make sure you don't leave anything behind and/or find yourself locked out! I find that most guests are happy to use the lock box and enter on their own when they arrive.  This works well for me too as arrival times are so varied.  No rooftop access.

name: 2 Twin Beds/Near Subway/Free Passes
transit: The subway (the T) is less than a 10-minute walk from our apartment, or a 2-5 minute bus ride (2 stops). The buses have a smartphone app that let you know when a bus will be arriving. Since we are right across the street, you can avoid waiting in the cold!   The T stop is "Forest Hills," which is at the southern end of the Orange Line. From the orange line you can connect to the red line, green line, and blue line, along with easy access to North Station and South Station. From Logan Airport (Public Transit) [45 minutes]: Take the Airport Shuttle to the Airport Blue Line stop. Ride the Blue Line Inbound to State Street, and change to the Orange Line to Forest Hills. From South Station (Public Transit) [40 minutes]: Take the Redline Inbound (Alewife) train up one stop to Downtown Crossing. Change to the Orange Line Outbound train to Forest Hills (last stop). See directions from Forest Hills.    From North Station: (Public Transit) [35 minutes]: Take the Orange Line Inbound to Forest Hil
access: Unlimited bus and subway passes during your stay Private bedroom with locking door Shared bathroom Kitchen with basic cooking utensils Dining room with seating Living room with couch, chairs & TV (Netflix, Hulu, HBO, STARZ) 2nd floor deck with outdoor chairs and table

name: Sunny, Elegant, Delicate
transit: Everything easily accessible, NO car needed. 3 blocks to Jackson Square subway & bus station (Orange Line)!  -$15 Uber / 7 miles from airport.  My place is just a 5 minute walk to the Stony Brook T station and Jackson square on the Orange line. From Stony brook to the city center is about a 20 minute ride. Copley Square is about 10-15 minutes away. For the Hospitals, you will need to go to Copley and switch to the Green line, or take a shuttle bus from Ruggles station. Or walk to Center Street, and take the #39 Bus straight to the Hospitals.  There is plenty of free, on-street parking in front of my house, or very close on the same block. - Stop & Shop Grocery Store located directly across the street. Dry cleaning, salon, clothing stores, Bank of America, Dunkin Donuts all located near apartment.  - Dominican, Cuban, Chinese, and American restaurants all located on our street.
access: This is a lovely, large room  plenty of light, a closet, dresser, table and chair. There is access to a full bathroom, clean towels, have acess to the kitchen and a wonderful back porch available for relaxing when weather permits. Basic amenities have been provided including Essentials, TV, Air Conditioning, Heatin, Wi-Fi. There is coffee and tea available at the kitchen.   I offer coffee and tea to all of my guest. Please clean after yourself in kitchen. Our home is a non-smoking environment. If you need to smoke, please do so outside and dispose of your cigarettes afterward.

name: Premier Downtown Boston Apt - Price Reduced!!!
Nice 1BD, Quick to Downtown, Free Parking
transit: Our personal recommendation is to use UberPool or Lyft Line to get downtown from our house. If you avoid morning and after work commutes, the rates are usually between $4 - $9, but can be more during surge periods. Taking public transportation from here will cost at least $1.70 per person in bus fare (if you have a Charlie Card, explained below) and usually involves a transfer (free), so it can be a little complicated for visitors and doesn't save you that much compared to UberPool or Lyft Line.   If you are planning on using public transportation while here, which can be a good idea when you are travelling between areas accessible by the T (our subway), we suggest that you get a Charlie Card. They are hard plastic cards that you can store value on and use to pay for T and bus fares. Additionally, the fares are discounted compared to paying cash or getting one time passes ($2.25 vs $2.75 for the T, $1.70 vs. $2.00 for bus). You can pick up a Charlie Card at any major T stop. name: Nice 2 BD, Quick to Downtown, Free Parking
transit: Our personal recommendation is to use UberPool or Lyft Line to get downtown from our house. If you avoid morning and after work commutes, the rates are usually between $4 - $9, but can be more during surge periods. Taking public transportation from here will cost at least $1.70 per person in bus fare (if you have a Charlie Card, explained below) and usually involves a transfer (free), so it can be a little complicated for visitors and doesn't save you that much compared to UberPool or Lyft Line.   If you are planning on using public transportation while here, which can be a good idea when you are travelling between areas accessible by the T (our subway), we suggest that you get a Charlie Card. They are hard plastic cards that you can store value on and use to pay for T and bus fares. Additionally, the fares are discounted compared to paying cash or getting one time passes ($2.25 vs $2.75 for the T, $1.70 vs. $2.00 for bus). You can pick up a Charlie Card at any major T stop. transit: My apartment is a 2 minute walk from the Airport T stop on the Blue Line (the T is the name of Boston's subway system). In 3 stops and 12 minutes the Blue Line will take you directly to historic Faneuil Hall in Downtown Boston.  If you're arriving from Logan Airport, take their free 22, 33, or 55 bus marked with "MBTA Blue Line" from the ground transportation curb to the Airport T stop, and then walk up and across the T tracks out into the park, and then a 2 minute walk to my front door. This system operates daily from 5:30 AM until about 1 AM.   Parking is free, but a challenge. Street parking on my street is plentiful, but you will have competition to find a good spot after 7 PM.  For drivers, my neighborhood has easy connection to I 93, I 90, and 1A.

transit: My apartment is a 2 minute walk from the Airport T stop on the Blue Line (the T is the name of Boston's subway system). In 3 stops and 12 minutes the Blue Line will take you directly to historic Faneuil Hall in Downtown Boston. If you're arriving from Logan Airport, take their free 22, 33, or 55 bus marked with "MBTA Blue Line" from the ground transportation curb to the Airport T stop, and then walk up and across the T tracks out into the park, and then a 2 minute walk to my front door. This system operates daily from 5:30 AM until about 1 AM. Parking is free, but a challenge. Street parking on my street is plentiful, but you will have competition to find a good spot after 7 PM. For drivers, my neighborhood has easy connection to I 93, I 90, and 1A.

Boylston station on the MBTA Green Line is located just beyond the northwest corner of Chinatown. Just east of Chinatown, South Station is served by the MBTA's Red Line, Silver Line, and Commuter Rail. South Station also accommodates Amtrak, the long-distance rail to New York City and other cities on the Northeast Corridor and also service to the west, including Chicago. The bus terminal at South Station handles regional buses to New England, New York City, Washington DC, Albany (New York), and other destinations. The New England destinations include Concord (New Hampshire) and Portland (Maine). The regional and national bus companies include Greyhound Lines, Peter Pan Bus Lines, Megabus, and Bolt Bus. name: Brand New One Bed Boston's Oldest Neighborhood
transit: Hay Market is the closest MBTA public transportation subway stop. North Station is also just a few blocks away. Grab an Uber from the Airport (or taxi) or you can take public transportation (Blue Line) to State St Stop. Uber and Lyft rides are usually very in-expensive, quick and efficient. Everywhere in Boston can be reached by foot or public transportation so we recommend not having a car.  But if you do there are some good options for parking: Parking is available at meters in 2 hour increments ($4.00 for 2 hours).  Meters are operational from 8 AM - 8 PM Monday - Saturday.  After 8 PM it's free to park overnight at a meter.  All of Sunday is free to park at meters. There is also visitor parking (coveted) on Hanover Street you can get lucky, just make sure and read the signs.  There is also a few visitor parking spots on Parmenter Street (coveted also). There are paid garages nearby $25 -$45 bucks.  I would suggest Government Center Garage (50 Sudbury St, Boston, MA (Phone number hi

transit: The home is a short walk (about 7 minutes) to the Green Street Orange Line subway, Chilacates Mexican Street Food, The Gate Restaurant and Bar, Doyles (classic) bar, Ula Cafe, and Sam Adams brewery, plus many more restaurants and shops. Another Orange Line stop (Stony Brook) is also under a ten minute walk. There is also the bus, Zipcar and Hubway rental bikes. Lots of non-resident street parking as well. Not terribly far away (about a 12 minute walk) is the Forest Hills Station station is the end of the Orange subway line, but also meets the commuter rail train and numerous bus lines. Also near the Forrest Hills Station you'll find a diner and several other bars and restaurants.  Only two blocks to the new Turtle Swamp Brewery!

name: Modern Comfort w/City View Near Airport & Downtown
transit: Very convenient to most everywhere in the city by train and walking per distances in summary section above.  Short 10-15min. taxi ride to Fenway Park, Copley Square, Seaport, and western points.  On-street parking is fairly easy *compared with other parts of Boston* with spots typically available within a block or two of the apartment on Chelsea and Bremen Streets. Note for those not familiar with Boston parking, it can be challenging. Best way to go is to not have a car or to pick up on the way out. If during the day on weekdays, please use the Sumner St. parking lot for $10/day per car, which is in Maverick Sq. a short 10min. walk away.
access: All parts of the condo except for the master bedroom straight ahead at end of hall on left coming through front door.

We suggest you to walk to Kenmore square and from there just walk downtown! It might be a long walk but you will see Newbury St, Prudential Center, Boston Common, Boston Public Garden, Freedom Trail, and LOTSSSS of cool places!

Most guests use public transportation, but some rent a bike or car, or use taxi, Lyft and/or Uber to get around. You can easily get to Cambridge and Harvard Square and MIT in 30-40 minutes with a simple train transfer. From the airport you will take the Silver line (free) from any terminal, to South Station where you will take the inbound train 1 stop to Downtown Crossing, and change to the Orange Line outbound towards Forest Hills. Easy! And of course, cabs are always plentiful from the airport (Uber is also popular here, but not allowed to pick you up directly from the airport - you can however use the silver line shuttle to get away from the airport and Uber from there).

name: Modern 4BR, Boston w/Parking, BCEC, Roof Deck
transit: Transportation. South Boston is served by two Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority Red Line rapid transit stations: Broadway and Andrew. In addition due to the development and revitalization of the South Boston Waterfront area, lead to the opening of a new station in South Boston. This new station was built and given the name of World Trade Center Station, this new location can be found on Congress St. in South Boston Waterfront. This is an affordable and safe way to travel throughout the Boston area. A ticket costs under $3 while an unlimited pass will cost $75. MBTA bus service connects these stations with the residential areas of South Boston, downtown Boston and the Back Bay. The MBTA Silver Line, a Bus rapid transit service running partly in a tunnel from South Station, also serves the north side of South Boston. South Boston is also served by five bus routes including the numbers 5, 7, 9, 10, 11. Similarly to the subway, the busing industry in South Boston also benefited fr

name: Great Location close to Harvard and Northeastern
Shelly's Place Bunk Room
transit: GETTING TO SHELLY'S PLACE To get to our house from the airport you have 3 options:  public transportation, taxi/uber, or (for the adventurous and robust guest) walking. FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION Take the free airport shuttle bus to the Airport Subway Station which is on the Blue Line.  These free shuttle buses run every 5-6 minutes and can be found curbside on the lower level of each terminal.  The buses are blue and white-- make sure that the shuttle bus you take will stop at the Airport Subway station (most do, but a few only provide service between terminals).  DO NOT take the Silver Line from the airport as this will take you to downtown Boston, not to our house. Once at the Airport Station (subway line), you will need to buy a Charlie Ticket at the ticket machines in the station lobby.  The cost is $2.75 for 1 ride.  You need to take the subway (Blue line) one stop to Wood Island.  Make sure that you take an Outbound subway going in the direction of Wonderland, NOT Bowdoin.  Ride

name: Pool, private room, and perfect location
transit: Brick House Pizza & Grille 256 Washington St. Want to go gourmet? Brick House Pizza takes pride in its fresh dough and tomato sauce, made with fresh-chopped, vine-ripened tomatoes. Try one of the many specialty pizzas—the Hawaiian BBQ (barbecued chicken, bacon, and pineapple) or the Florentine (baby spinach, chopped garlic, and ricotta). Or choose your favorite ingredients to stuff a personalized calzone. Brick House also serves salads, subs, wraps, dinner specials, and burgers. A classic sirloin cheeseburger, salad, and choice of fries or onion rings is less than $6. On a nice day, you can sit at one of the eatery’s outdoor tables. The Green Briar 304 Washington St. This is no ordinary Irish pub: it’s as close to the real thing as you’ll find on this side of the Atlantic. If you follow international sports—particularly any of the Irish teams—this is the place for you. The pub broadcasts live Irish sporting events, including rugby, soccer, and hurling (find the current sports schedule

name: Loft Style 1 Mile from Downtown Boston Brownstone.
transit: Parking here is free 24 hours a day. But the key is to get here before like 4pm to 430pm. Because after that the street fills up and it can get very difficult to find a spot. My neighbors would prefer if you park at the end of my street and not directly in front of my building. But its still a free country on our street, and do as you feel, but parking up here is special, so try to think of my neighbors. I truly would like to keep parking up here free and without parking permits and meter maids. :)  Uber is probably the best way to get around.

Use Spothero or BestParking app for the best parking deals if you want to drive downtown from JP... but consider using public transportation. It's really easy, and I'm happy to help you navigate.

This is the most convenient way to get into Downtown because it is only one mode of transportation.    For best results, download the "Transit" App from (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)Play or the AppStore. It is fully integrated with the MBTA and has an awesome GPS feature.

name: cute and cozy 3rd floor apt
transit: My place is very close to public transportation. Three buses are a 5 minute walk from the house. These buses will take you to Forest Hills in approximately 15-20 minutes. From there you will take the Orange Line for a quick trip to Downtown Boston. You may also walk 15 minutes (or take a quick bus ride) to the Bellevue stop(purple line)  in Roslindale Village and take the commuter rail into downtown. Cambridge is 7.9 miles away and approximately 26 minutes by car and 57 minutes by subway.
access: Guests will have access to a private two bedroom apartment on the third floor that has a Living room with a futon couch and small flat screen t.v, free wifi, a master bedroom with a comfortable full size bed and a second bedroom with 2 twin size beds, a private bathroom, parking and a washer/dryer in the basement. There will be extra toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags in the back hallway on the shelf. Please take them when you need them. Please help yourself to any snacks, tea or coffee in the cabinets. There is also a back porch on the FIRST floor and a large backyard.  Please do not use the porch on the third floor or the closet in the back hallway outside of your main back door.

name: Lux 1 Bedroom Apt Near Waterfront w/wifi
transit: Most locals in Boston get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport.

name: Shared Space for the Social Traveler 1.51L
transit: I personally use BLUE BIKES to get everywhere (i.e. Boston's bike rental service), as cycling is consistently faster [and more fun/scenic] than public transit and about as fast as a car.  ^ It's $2.50/ride or $10 for a day pass.  ^ location: Warren St at MLK Blvd {across the street and to the left} The public transit in Boston is ~$2/ride and, in my opinion, frustratingly slow (#spoiledinasia). Even though the triple bus pickup to the Ruggles metro and Dudley bus stations is incredibly convenient, I recommend tourists on a time clock utilize the ride-sharing apps UBER and LYFT in combination with public transportation.  ^ An Uber Pool or Lyft Line to Downtown Crossing only costs $3-$8 at off-peak times.

name: Shelly's Place Garden Room
transit: GETTING TO SHELLY'S PLACE To get to our house from the airport you have 3 options:  public transportation, taxi/uber, or (for the adventurous and robust guest) walking. FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION Take the free airport shuttle bus to the Airport Subway Station which is on the Blue Line.  These free shuttle buses run every 5-6 minutes and can be found curbside on the lower level of each terminal.  The buses are blue and white-- make sure that the shuttle bus you take will stop at the Airport Subway station (most do, but a few only provide service between terminals).  DO NOT take the Silver Line from the airport as this will take you to downtown Boston, not to our house. Once at the Airport Station (subway line), you will need to buy a Charlie Ticket at the ticket machines in the station lobby.  The cost is $2.75 for 1 ride.  You need to take the subway (Blue line) one stop to Wood Island.  Make sure that you take an Outbound subway going in the direction of Wonderland, NOT Bowdoin.  Ride

name: Fenway Park walk ★ 1 Free Parking Spot ★ No stairs
transit: Walk everywhere! You'll be super close to lots of attractions! Though if you want to take the subway, we call it T in Boston, you can walk to several stations from our home: Fenway (Green Line D) Kenmore (Green Line B, C, and D) Ruggles (Orange Line) All these stations takes you directly Downtown and so many iconic places. We suggest you to walk to Kenmore square and from there just walk downtown! It might be a long walk but you will see Newbury St, Prudential Center, Boston Common, Boston Public Garden, Freedom Trail,  and LOTSSSS of cool places!
access: ★ EASY CHECK IN! EASY CHECK OUT! You don't have to worry about us giving you the key because there's a lockbox with the apartment's key waiting for you. Five days before your reservation begins we will send you a super detailed message that includes a mini guide made with love that will show you instructions of how to access the apartment, how and where to park your car, and plenty of recommendations of things to do. We respect your privacy and we won't bother you! But if you need us we are here 24/7 for you. We live very close!

For the same cost of $2.25, you can get to Logan Airport in 40 minutes, Harvard University and MIT in 30-35 minutes, and Fenway Park in 30 minutes.

name: Sunny 2 Bed

Cozy South End Studio
transit: In addition to getting around by walking, Boston city taxis, and Uber, you will be able to use the subway (the “T”) to access other parts of Boston.  Below is a brief summary of the subway lines nearby. Green Line.  Take a left out the front door, walk down Cumberland and take a right on Huntington.  At the next intersection cross West Newton and you will see the entrance to the Green Line station.  This will take you into downtown Boston or the outbound will take you to the Symphony and the Museum of Fine Arts. Orange Line.  Take a left out the front door.  Take another left onto St. Botolph.  Walk until you hit Massachusetts Avenue.  Take a left and you will see the Massachusetts Avenue station of the Orange Line.  This line will take you to Downtown and connects to the Blue Line and the airport as well as the North End and Charlestown.

name: East Boston Gem * Full Apartment One Bedroom
transit: One minute walk to public transportation, cab stands and water taxis.  One train stop or 5 mins ride from airport.  Street parking (please read the street signs).  There is a parking lot one minute away.  The parking is $12 for 24 hrs.  As for the in/out privileges, basically as long as no one takes your spot you can come back in but if someone does you have to pay again.  It’s a small little place run privately so it’s kind of old fashion.  There’s also an old school cab there stand run by the same people so they can help you if you use it.   Close to 24 hr convenient stores, restaurants, fast food, salons, nail shops, gyms, parks, Dunkin Donuts and dry cleaners.
access: The whole apartment, full Private kitchen, dining room living room, full bathroom and separate bedroom.  Not shared with other guests.   Basic kitchen utensils, pots, pans, cups.  Dining room table to eat at.  Towel per guest, blanket and linens per bed.   WiFi passwords come day of travel.  TV has Cable and Netflix, Roku, etc access but you must use own membership.  There is no cable or local access.  You can sign on to Netflix or other TV apps but most of our guest gather at the bar across the street or in town to watch the games.   Why sit in the apartment?  You’re on vacation to see the city :) Soap, shampoo and conditioner.  Iron and ironing board. A list of things to do are left in the apartment. We have guests before you so we can not accommodate early check in.   We have to give time for prior guests to check out and cleaning.   You are definitely welcome to leave your luggage in the Common Hall then go right to Touristing! :).  Please let us know.   If you want to stick around

name: The Historic House in the North End/Waterfront
transit: The North End has narrow, dense streets. There are no major through streets that penetrate the North End, and virtually all trips made within the neighborhood are made by walking. Commercial Street has two lanes of northbound and one lane of southbound traffic; and goes around the North End's perimeter. Hanover Street goes from downtown to the shoreline, and is the most concentrated area for tourists, parades, and festivals. The North End is accessible via mass transit, including the MBTA’s Orange and Green Lines at both Haymarket and North Station, by the Blue Line at Aquarium Station, and by multiple bus lines. It is also accessible by ferry at Rowes Wharf and Long Wharf.  Parking is mostly available by North End resident stickers, so we recommend parking at The North End Garage (Brinks Garage) site located at 600 Commercial St, which is a few blocks away.
access: The property is a single family home so guests have access to the house in a  private setting. Neighbors are on both sides of the property, so we ask all guests to be respectful of your noise and actions coming inside and outside of the property.

name: 9beds/Central A/C-4mi to city FreePk•stepstoT
transit: There is 24 street parking in front of the house, NO meter to feed. From Logan airport the easiest way is to take a taxi, Uber or lyft and it will take you 15-20 minutes with no traffic . You could also take free silver line bus to south station, then switch to the Red line. Hop on the red line to Ashmont, stop at Savin Hill station. Then walk 10 minutes to the address .  If you are commuting via transportation there are buses #15 and 17 in front of the building. There are 2 buses literally right across from the house and from there you can go to the historical places in Boston Bus #15 rides about 20 minutes to Ruggles T station to catch orange line subway. The train rides about 10 minutes to the center of Boston- Downtown crossing.  Bus # 17 rides about 15 minutes to Andrew T station Red line subway. From there the train rides about 8-10 minutes to the center of Boston-downtown crossing. Also you can walk 12 minutes to Savin hill station to hop on the red line and go anywhere.  Redlin
access: Guests have access to the fully equipped kitchen, two bathrooms. Also the balcony and patio. Enjoy the backyard area with an outdoor barbecue grill.  Enjoy free coffee at your convenience. There are 24 hour free street parking. You have access to the porch and backyard.

Please don't the Red line, it leaves yo far out from our house. Many of our guests have done that and regreted.  From South Station take the red line to the orange line snd follow the above directions. We encourage you to go to Boston's website to learn about our transportation system and better plan you visit. It's not the best system but it works. Consider getting a Charlie Card for reduced fares.

name: Boston Business Bungalow
transit: You will not find a location more easily and equally accessible to all forms of transportation! Parking: Free street side parking (not crowded at all). Driving: located just off the intersection of Boston's two main highways: I-93 and I-90 (Mass Pike) you have quick access to both. Perfect for people driving in from New Hampshire or Maine, you avoid the city traffic altogether and can pull in and park and take the T in. MBTA (Public Transportation): Located equally close to two stops on the Blue Line: Suffolk Downs and Orient Heights. For those that don't know, the blue line is by far the cleanest, fastest and most underrated line on the T, and has the best air conditioning! (See more in A Southerner's Guide To Boston, Chapter 2: The Art of The MBTA). I prefer Suffolk Downs over Orient Heights even though it's technically farther but a negligible distance. Flying: Two stops away from the Airport stop on the Blue Line

transit: Nearest T stop at Haymarket is a 10 min. walk. ~~ Parking in the North End of Boston ~~ 1.The best place to park without paying is in a visitors’ lot on Hanover Street.    Pay attention to the signs because some are from 8am-6pm and some are 12pm –6pm.  Free parking is limited usually to two hours and is often enforced. 2.Metered parking is usually available all along Commercial Street, which runs perpendicular to Hanover Street.  Bring plenty of quarters. 3.For overnight parking, I recommend parking in the Sargent’s Wharf on Commercial Street, right next to Starbucks.    The cost for overnight parking runs between $9 and $14, but be sure to check the rate schedule, because the rate may change for the daytime.   For overnight parking on the street, most parking spaces are reserved for residents or valet parking zones. 4.There is also an indoor garage near the Fleet center called the North End Garage. 5.Meter maids are notorious in the North End. transit: Broadluxe Lofts are located steps from the Greenway, offering residents easy access to everything Boston has to offer. There's no need to have a car to get around. If you have a car, parking is plentiful with a parking garage one block west of the building at One Post Office Square ($10 all day weekend parking) and 10 other garages within a quarter-mile radius. There is a cab stand in front of the Hilton hotel next door. The closest MBTA subway station is Aquarium (Blue line), just a 3-minute walk away. Being in the heart of downtown Boston, all other subway lines are less than a 10-minute walk away as well:  Orange line (State Street, 6 minutes or Downtown Crossing, 9 minutes), Green Line (Government Center, 9 minutes), Red line (Park Street or South Station, 9 minutes). Transit Score is 100! If you’d like to rent a bike, there are three Hubway stations in close proximity to the Broadluxe Lofts as well. Bike Score is 82. Logan International Airport is only a 5-minute trip on the MBTA

Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have my cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11am check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for my cleaning people to do the same. Also, you can take Red Line to Downtown Crossing or Park Street; both are considered as downtown of the Boston. If you have other plans, you can change to Orange Line on Downtown Crossing and to Green Line on Part Street. If you are coming from Logan Airport you can take Silver Line and change to Red Line on South Station.

name: Huge Multilevel Brownstone 2Bed/2Bath Apartment
transit: One minute walk to public transportation, cab stands and water taxis.  One train stop or 5 mins ride from airport.   Street parking (please read the street signs). access: This is a private whole apartment space on the second floor of an apartment building. It is a tri-level apt. The main floor has the kitchen, living room, dining room, and bathroom. The bedrooms are located on the second and third floors.   Not shared with other guests.   Basic kitchen utensils, pots, pans, cups.  Dining room table to eat at.   Towel per guest, blanket and linens per bed.   TV has Netflix, Roku, etc access but you must use own membership.  There is no cable or local access.  You can sign on to Netflix or other TV apps but most of our guest gather at the bar across the street or in town to watch the games.   Why sit in the apartment?  You’re on vacation to see the city :) Soap, shampoo and conditioner.  Iron and ironing board. A list of things to do are left in the apartment. We have guests before you so we can not accommodate early check in.   We have to give time for prior guests to check out and cleaning.   You are definitely welcome to leave your luggage in the Commo

access: The entire unit (kitchen, bathroom, living room, bedrooms). Parking is often available on the street during the daytime and weekends, but much more difficult at night and during snow emergencies. Keyless entry system. As your arrival date nears, 1 day prior, you will be sent a message with instructions for electronic keycode access. Check in time is 3pm, and check out time is 11am - that gives us a 4 hour window to have our cleaning crew fully clean, disinfect, change sheets, for your arrival and the guest coming in after you. You can check in anytime thereafter. Please note that this also means that the 11a check out must be strictly adhered to on your last day, as we may have another guest checking in that afternoon, and need time for our cleaning people to do the same. Unlike a hotel that has multiple rooms to shuffle around, that is not the case here.

VIA Subway (The T) Boston's subway system, called the T by locals, has two stations in very close proximity: From Back Bay station (1-2 min walking distance) you can take the Orange line, which goes from Jamaica Plains all the way through downtown Boston and then through Cambridge to the Assembly Outlet Mall From Arlington station (1-2 min walking distance) you can take the Green line, which can take you anywhere from Somerville/Kendall Square to Northeastern University, Boston College, and Boston University.  VIA Car There are several paid covered parking garages within walking distance (1 min and 3 min walking distance) VIA Plane The Logan Express, a convenient direct bus shuttle to and from Logan Airport (all terminals), stops in Copley Square, only 2 minutes walking d

transit: MBTA Commuter Rail and local bus and Red Line T service is all within a 10-15 minute walk of the house, which gives easy vehicle-free access to the entire City of Boston and its many attractions. Of street parking is available for one car, and the house is easily accessible from all major freeways. Of course, Uber/Lyft is always an option if you'd rather not drive or take public transit.
access: With the exception of my private bedroom, guests are welcome to use the entire house and make themselves at home. A key will be provided so that guests can come and go as they please, and there is an available bicycle for exploring the nearby Neponset River Walk and Bike Trail and the Blue Hills Reservation.

name: Location! Beautiful 3 Bedroom Apt, Free Parking!
transit: Boston Landing Commuter Rail Station (0.1 miles) (*only runs on commuter schedule, check on MBTA site*, $2.25 to Fenway Park-Back Bay- South Station)  Allston St T station green line (0.6 miles)  Logan Airport (7.7 miles, take I90, 12min to 24min depends on traffic)  Direct buses or quick Uber rides to: Harvard Business School (1 mile)  Harvard University (1.6 miles, bus 66)  Boston University (1.2 miles, bus 57)  Also within 10-15min drive to Back Bay, Downtown areas taking I90 down the street)  Grocery stores: Super Stop&Shop (0.1 miles Everett St)  Star Market (0.7 miles Western Ave)  Trader Joe's (0.9 miles North Harvard St) Fave Restaurants and Cafes Nearby (too many to count, seriously!): Lone Star Tacos (0.1 miles) The Glenville Stops (0.5 miles) Deep Ellum (0.1 miles) Twin Donuts (0.1 miles)  Whole Heart Vegetarian (0.1 miles)  Carlos Italiana (0.4 miles)  Spring Shabu Shabu Buffet (0.6 miles)  Fish Market Sushi (0.3 miles) Loui Loui Cajun Food (0.3 miles)  Chicken and Rice Guy
access: The whole apartment including laundry room in unit, kitchen and 1 guest parking included. Parking spot is at the back of the house.

name: Sublet in Boston (Aug 1 - Aug 31, 2018)
Central location North End/Waterfront 2Bedroom Apt
transit: The North End/ Downtown location allows for walking to most Boston sites and attractions.  Also, chose to ride the subway which is just  a 10 minute walk. Most sights are between 3 and 20 minute walk.  There is a parking lot across the way that is between $22 and $28 per 24 hours of parking.
access: You have access to the entire apartment.  Spread out and enjoy!  Laundry is common and in building.

name: Back Bay/Fenway Place
transit: Parking in Boston is a challenge. The unit itself does not have a dedicated parking space. Boston is a very walkable city and you will be staying close to many places of interest.  Boston is America´s walking city. However, you will be located right by the Massachusetts Avenue subway/Metro stop on the Orange Line and 5 minutes walking to the Symphony stop on the Green Line. The number 1 bus stops right across the street and takes you directly to Harvard University or MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and hundreds of other attractions and points of interest. You will not find an more convenient place to stay and get around Boston. However, if you need to have a car, we suggest you check the app SpotHero (there is a website with the same name. You can check availability by searching on the app or the website for the address of the unit. The search will let you know about affordable  parking spaces available in the neighborhood.
access: Guests can access all areas of the apartment: kitchen, bedroom, living room, bathroom.  The unit is tastefully and well decorated thinking on your comfort. The spacious bedroom has a queen size bed, a desk and a chair, it also has space for you to store your clothes.  The living room has a sofa bed where 2 can sleep comfortable and we also provide a air mattress for one more person. We provide all clean and fresh linens, sheets, pillow covers and blankets.  The kitchen is well equipped with everything you need for a basic cooking. We also provide coffee, sugar and cream, as well as tea.   There is washing and dryer machines outside the apartment that are used by all the tenants in the building and guests are welcome to use. The washer and dryer are coin operated.

name: Modern & cozy entire Apt at vibrant South End

name: Spacious 1 BR. Apt. in Allston - all to yourself!
transit: Our apartment is immediately across from the B Green Line train and the 66 bus, which goes to Cambridge. The bus runs about every 10-15 minutes. The apartment is a 10 minute walk to Coolidge Corner and 15 minutes to Boston University's West Campus. It is also a 30 minute walk to Harvard Business School, and 40 minutes from Fenway.
access: You'll have private access to the entire apartment.

name: Penthouse in the sky with Starbucks
transit: Transportation. South Boston is served by two Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority Red Line rapid transit stations: Broadway and Andrew. In addition due to the development and revitalization of the South Boston Waterfront area, lead to the opening of a new station in South Boston. This new station was built and given the name of World Trade Center Station, this new location can be found on Congress St. in South Boston Waterfront. This is an affordable and safe way to travel throughout the Boston area. A ticket costs under $3 while an unlimited pass will cost $75. MBTA bus service connects these stations with the residential areas of South Boston, downtown Boston and the Back Bay. The MBTA Silver Line, a Bus rapid transit service running partly in a tunnel from South Station, also serves the north side of South Boston. South Boston is also served by five bus routes including the numbers 5, 7, 9, 10, 11. Similarly to the subway, the busing industry in South Boston also benefited fr

access: Boston at its best!  Outstanding Location in the south end.  Many local restaurants in walking distance even across the street. Classic Victorian style row housing with many neighboring parks.  Great transit system with bus stop directly in-front of your private get away.  Minutes from the theater district, Boston Common, Faneuil Hall market place.  Home of some of the best schools in the country (Harvard, MIT, BC & BU).  So much to see you will have to come back and visit us again.  Enjoy our place and tell your friends, happy travels.

name: Washington 201 | 2BR 2BA | Doyle's Pub
transit: By subway Orange Line: The Jackson Square, Stony Brook, Green St., and Forest Hills stops are all located in Jamaica Plain. Each stop takes you to a fairly different part of the neighborhood. The Jackson Square stop, for example, is set in a section of the neighborhood that is both commercial and residential while the Stony Brook stop is set in an almost exclusively residential section of JP. The Green Street stop is the closest to the section of Centre St. considered to be "downtown" JP. 3389 Washington is 4 blocks to the Green Street Station of the OrangeLine. By bus The 39 Bus follows the same route at the E branch of the Green Line, but continues beyond Heath Street (where the "E" Line ends), up South Huntington Avenue, up Centre Street through "downtown" JP, and ends at Forest Hills. 3389 Washington is 6 blocks to Forest Hills T Station. By bicycle The Southwest Corridor Park, which begins at Back Bay Station, stretches to Forest Hills and includes one of the best bike paths in th

name: Parker Hill 206 | 1BR 1BA |  Beth Israel Deaconess
transit: LMA is served by two rail stations at opposite ends of Longwood Avenue: "Longwood" (on the MBTA Green Line's "D" branch) and "Longwood Medical Area" (on the "E" branch). Several public bus routes serve the area and commuter rail service is available at nearby Ruggles Station. MASCO offers shuttle buses (generally for affiliated personnel only) around the Longwood Medical Area and between Harvard's Cambridge Campus and the Medical Campus (M2). The M2 shuttle is free for passengers holding a Harvard ID, and tickets can be purchased at multiple locations. 70 Parker Hill Avenue is located 2 blocks up from the Mission Park Station on the "E" Line of the GreenLine of Boston's famous transit system, commonly referred to as the "T."
access: Full apartment access in a secured and quiet brick building.  A true sanctuary in the big city!

name: Quiet 2 Bedrooms in Beacon Hill - Walk to T!
transit: Our condo is very walkable to many locations! ACCESS TO T STATIONS: BOWDOIN T STATION : Blue line - To Logan Airport (domestic and international air travel), New England Aquarium, and Revere Beach. MGH T STATION : Red line - goes to Harvard Univ., MIT, and South Station (for national train and bus travel). PARK STREET T: Red Line and Green Line (which goes to almost everywhere in Boston - Back Bay/Copley/Prudential, Boston College, Boston University, Kenmore, Fenway, Longwood Medical Center, and Boston Suburbs).  ------------------------------------------------------- ***Parking Info*** Here are the closest parking garages, please do a quick search for prices as they may change with the season:  1) Standard Parking: 100 Cambridge St. Boston 2) Charles St. Parking Garage: 144 Charles St. Boston 3) Meters are free from 8PM-8AM and Sunday on certain streets.
access: ***NOTE: Feel free to bring your own supplies (i.e. towels, pillows, sheets, etc.) if you have particular preferences! Please ask us if any supplies run out/if you would like more. There is a laundromat located near the building.

If you are arriving by bus to Boston through South Station, when you arrive: You should enter the Purple Line Commuter train Outbound to "Talbot Avenue Station" The residence is steps away.  2. If you are arriving by flight through Logan International Airport: Enter the shuttle from the airport that will bring you to "SOUTH STATION" When you arrive South Station access the Purple line Commuter Train Outbound and take it to "TALBOT AVENUE" purple line stop, the residence is steps away. From South Station which is also downtown you can also access other line stations that can bring you to other nearby stations around me see below  OTHER NEARBY STATIONS  1. name: Bright 1 Bedroom in Fantastic Fenway/Back Bay!
transit: The T is most convenient, but there is limited metered parking on surrounding streets and Uber accessibility. If you do have a car, there is no parking that comes with the apartment, however there is metered parking available on the street.  You will either need quarters to pay the meter during daytime hours, or you can use the parking app ParkBoston.  Information is listed on the meter.  It will still require to you move your car on occasion.  There are some parking garages near by but they are expensive.  Use (Hidden by Airbnb) for more information.

Both stations are a short 1.9 miles away. The commuter rail (purple line) is less than 1 mile away and takes you right into South Station...for connection to the airport and convention center!  Close to Routes 90W -Mass Pike, 93 & 95.

name: Proper Boston studio apartment at Fenway Park
CHESTNUT ROOM ★ Chic & Large - 15 Mins to Downtown
transit: It's easy! The subway station nearby is MBTA Airport Station. It is only 10 minutes away by walking. You can walk to MBTA Airport Station, hop on to Blue Line and take it two stops towards the Aquarium. Once you come out, you'll be right in the heart of Boston where you can easily explore by foot. Alternatively, we highly recommend to use Uber. With Uber Pool, most rides to downtown Boston or Cambridge will be under $10 and be very quick. You can also try out Boston's Bike Share network called Hubway. A day's pass is just $6 and gives you 24 hours of unlimited bike usage (in 30 minute segments). It’s super convenient to go to Boston Logan Airport as well, you can walk to the MBTA Airport Station from the house, and from there hop on a free airport shuttle to get to all the airport terminals easily.
access: Fast Wi-Fi available, so you can catch up with friends or on work at any time.  A fully featured kitchen is available at your disposal. Great opportunity to relax, have a snack or meet other guests.  Keurig K-Cup coffee machine with unlimited gourmet coffee. Complimentary tea selection is also available. Great way to start your morning!  Access to the fridge, with free snacks and drinks provided. Private shelf space offered for each room.  Two and a half shared bathrooms are available in the apartment. Two of them feature a full size shower.  Comfortable living room area with games and books for your enjoyment. Relax on the couch after a day of exploring the city. Everything is brand-new, modern and very comfortable. Necessities, like fresh towels and linens are provided upon arrival. Additionally, toiletries like shampoo and body wash are provided free of charge.

name: Lux 1 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WIFI
transit: Most locals get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport. Fenway gives you everything you love about city living and with a T-stop right next door, you’ll be free to explore all Boston has to offer with ease.

When walking is not practical, the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport. Fenway gives you everything you love about city living and with a T-stop right next door, you’ll be free to explore all Boston has to offer with ease.

access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms. name: BRONZE ROOM ★ Modern & Bright- 15 Mins to Downtown
transit: It's easy! The subway station nearby is MBTA Airport Station. It is only 10 minutes away by walking. You can walk to MBTA Airport Station, hop on to Blue Line and take it two stops towards the Aquarium. Once you come out, you'll be right in the heart of Boston where you can easily explore by foot. Alternatively, we highly recommend to use Uber. With Uber Pool, most rides to downtown Boston or Cambridge will be under $10 and be very quick. You can also try out Boston's Bike Share network called Hubway. A day's pass is just $6 and gives you 24 hours of unlimited bike usage (in 30 minute segments). It’s super convenient to go to Boston Logan Airport as well, you can walk to the MBTA Airport Station from the house, and from there hop on a free airport shuttle to get to all the airport terminals easily.
access: Fast Wi-Fi available, so you can catch up with friends or on work at any time.  A fully featured kitchen is available at your disposal. Great opportunity to relax, have a snack or meet other guests.  Keurig K-Cup coffee machine with unlimited gourmet coffee. Complimentary tea selection is also available. Great way to start your morning!  Access to the fridge, with free snacks and drinks provided. Private shelf space offered for each room.  Two and a half shared bathrooms are available in the apartment. Two of them feature a full size shower.  Comfortable living room area with games and books for your enjoyment. Relax on the couch after a day of exploring the city. Everything is brand-new, modern and very comfortable. Necessities, like fresh towels and linens are provided upon arrival. Additionally, toiletries like shampoo and body wash are provided free of charge.

transit: It takes no more than a 2-minute walk to catch either the 57 (Kenmore/Watertown Yard), 57A (Kenmore), or 66 (Dudley via Harvard) buses from the apartment. The Harvard Ave. stop on the B branch of the Green line is 5-minutes away on foot. You couldn't ask for a more accessible location.

name: Spacious and Eclectic South End Condo
transit: Free on-street parking is available on Shawmut Avenue for guests with a car, no resident sticker necessary. Though space is limited, it is not difficult to find a spot where a car can be parked for days at a time. For garages, Boston University Medical Center has a number of moderately-priced parking structures along with the Stanhope and Northampton Sq. garages on Mass Ave. One block from the condo is Washington St. and the Silver Line, a bus line which provides straightforward and cheap access to Chinatown, South Station, and the Airport. A 10 minute walk up Massachusetts Avenue will take you to either the Green or Orange Line subways which provide further routes to the heart of Boston or out to the suburbs. On Massachusetts Ave itself is the 1 bus which shuttles riders as far north as Central Square and Harvard Square.

name: Spacious one bedroom
4mi to Downtown•BCEC•FreePk• steps to T
transit: There is 24 hour street parking in front of the house, no meter to feed. From Logan airport the easiest way is to take a taxi, Uber or lyft and it will take you 15-20 minutes with no traffic . You could also take free silver line bus to south station, then switch to the Red line. Hop on the red line to Ashmont, stop at Savin Hill station. Then walk 12 minutes to the address . If you are commuting via transportation there are buses #15 and 17 in front of the building. Also you can walk 12 minutes to Savin hill station to hop on the red line and go anywhere. The train takes 10 minutes to downtown and 5 minutes to Jfk/Umass Station. Redline is the most convenient line in Boston subway. It connects Savin Hill to South Station, Downtown, Park Street, MGH Hospital, MIT, Havard Square,etc. Beach at 8 minutes away. We are 3 miles from the city. South Bay center and Dorchester Brewing at 5 minute away. Enjoy the free wifi and quiet setting.
access: Guests have access to the fully equipped kitchen, living room with TV and two bathroom. There are 2 coffee makers coffee available at your convenience. There are 24 hour free street parking. You have access to the porch and backyard.

From the economy lot, you can take a shuttle to the Airport T station and walk or Uber from there.

name: Casa Luna

From there you can reach Downtown Crossing, Chinatown, and or Seaport within a few minutes. No car is needed in Boston! If by car you can access Blue Hills Reservation for a hike by taking 138. Curry College has an outdoor track for exercise. You can head to Milton as well to Abbey Park or Naga restaurants. Both phenomenal!  93 can be access to go to Boston  Lastly 95 can take you to Legacy Place that has a movie theater, bowling alley, and over 100 stores of shopping or Providence. Neighborhood Favorites Fairmount Grill -American cuisine, good beer and spirit selection. $$- Affordable Antonio’s Bacaro- Italian cuisine, great wine selection and cocktails. $$$- Mid to High Rincón- Latin cuisine- Plays music a bit louder and sadly we have just had a drink there. $-Affordable

transit: The Subway:  You are just seconds from Andrew Station on the redline.  Most of the sight-seeing goodness of Boston are just minutes away.  After you enter the station, take the train that goes towards 'Alewife' direction, and here are some our favorite highlights by each stops: - South Station (2 stops away): This is a major train station in Boston.  You are only a stone throw away from awesome neighborhoods like the Seaport area (just walk across the bridge), Chinatown, and Financial District. 		 - Downtown Crossing (3 stops away): This is the heart of Boston Downtown.  On Washington street you can find shopping, restaurants, and coffee shops.  This is the stop where you can also transfer to Orange line subway that will take you to Haymarket station (North End/Little Italy) and North Station (TD Garden). - Park Street (4 stops away): Upon exiting the station, you will find the oldest city park in the US (dated from 1634), Boston Common, as well as the start of the Freedom Trail.  Hist

transit: If utilizing a car to get around Boston, there is plenty of free on-street parking near the house. Please don't block the driveway or ignore any cones left out by neighbors. If biking, there are plenty of trails and bike lanes on the streets within the city. By public transit, which I recommend for big outings like concerts, sporting events, etc., guests should utilize the train station. It's a 10 minute walk to the Ashmont train station, which is on the Redline train. From there you can access all of Boston including Downtown Boston, Boston Common, Faneuil Hall and many of Boston's locations. The walk is a straight shot up the street, or take an Uber or ride the #21 bus from the fire station near by (2 minute walk).

transit: Public Transit: The apartment is a 7-minute walk from Forest Hills Station, which is one of the major hubs for all busses and trains (both the T and the commuter rail). Biking/Walking/Running: It's easy to get places in Boston by running/walking/biking. The apartment is just a few miles from downtown. Boston has Hubway (bike sharing), and there are stations in the center of JP. You can also drive around Boston. There's free street parking near the apartment. Also, Boston has Zip Car, and there are plenty of renting stations nearby.

transit: If you are arriving from the airport, the easiest way would be to order a taxi/uber. It should cost between $20 and $30 depending on time and traffic and will take between 15 and 25 minutes. Unfortunately there is no efficient public transportation that would take under 1 hour.  If you are arriving to South Station via Train or Bus you can either take the Purple Line (Metro) which should be about 30 minutes or and Uber/Taxi which will cost $15 to $20 and take about 15 minutes. If you are driving, the address is very easy to find via GPS Navigation, and I have a parking spot behind the house.  Getting around after you have arrived is very easy. The apartment is especially well connected for car transportation and there is no place in Boston or Cambridge that should take you more than 15 minutes. As for public transportation, it will vary depending on your destination, but the fastest access is to Harvard Square and the Cambridge area. Here are some times to main points of interest: - Ha

name: Guest room on top of Fort Hill, Jamaica Plain/Roxb
transit: GETTING THERE AND AROUND: 7-10 minutes walk down hill to Roxbury Crossing Orange Line Stop, and 66 Bus to Harvard Square. From Roxbury Crossing, it is a short ride to Boston Downtown and you can change easily change to the other major lines (e.g. Red Line at Downtown Crossing or Park Street to go to South Station or Harvard; Green Line at Park Street). Boston also has rental bikes (e.g. Hubway) and the Boston Bike corridor is located very close to our house. Our place is also an easy UBER ride from the airport (only 8 miles) - which might be a good idea especially when you are travelling with heavy luggage (We live on Fort HILL ;)). Alternatively, you could take the silver line(s) and then hop on the T to Roxbury Crossing.

transit: Hop on a train at Andrew T/Red line station and go to - South Station in 5 mins; - Boston Common in 7 mins; - MIT in 10 mins; - Harvard University in 15 mins. Taxis/Uber/Lyft/Hailo are easy to catch in our neighborhood.  Take the bus #5 or #11 to downtown Boston within 20-30 mins. DIRECTIONS TO Boston Logan Airport: - SUBWAY (40 min): take the Red Line train from Andrew station inbound 2 stops to South Station and transfer to Silver Line SL1 to the airport terminals. - UBER (10 min) Boston Convention & Exhibition Center: - UBER (5 min) - SUBWAY (20 min): take the Red Line train from Andrew station inbound 2 stops to South Station and transfer to Silver Line SL1 or SL2 2 stops to World Trade Center station. The convention center is right across Summer Street.

name: Washington Unit 2 | 3BR 2BA | 2nd Floor
transit: By subway Orange Line: The Jackson Square, Stony Brook, Green St., and Forest Hills stops are all located in Jamaica Plain. Each stop takes you to a fairly different part of the neighborhood. The Jackson Square stop, for example, is set in a section of the neighborhood that is both commercial and residential while the Stony Brook stop is set in an almost exclusively residential section of JP. The Green Street stop is the closest to the section of Centre St. considered to be "downtown" JP. 3389 Washington is 4 blocks to the Green Street Station of the OrangeLine. By bus The 39 Bus follows the same route at the E branch of the Green Line, but continues beyond Heath Street (where the "E" Line ends), up South Huntington Avenue, up Centre Street through "downtown" JP, and ends at Forest Hills. 3389 Washington is 6 blocks to Forest Hills T Station. By bicycle The Southwest Corridor Park, which begins at Back Bay Station, stretches to Forest Hills and includes one of the best bike paths in th

transit: There is 24 street parking in front of the house, NO meter to feed. From Logan airport the easiest way is to take a taxi, Uber or lyft and it will take you 15-20 minutes with no traffic . You could also take free silver line bus to south station, then switch to the Red line. Hop on the red line to Ashmont, stop at Fields corner station. Then walk 8 minutes to the address .  If you are commuting via transportation there are buses #15 and 17 in front of the building. There are 2 buses literally right across from the house and from there you can go to the historical places in Boston Bus #15 rides about 20 minutes to Ruggles T station to catch orange line subway. The train rides about 10 minutes to the center of Boston- Downtown crossing.  Bus # 17 rides about 15 minutes to Andrew T station Red line subway. From there the train rides about 8-10 minutes to the center of Boston-downtown crossing. Also you can walk 12 minutes to Savin hill station to hop on the red line and go anywhere.  Redl

name: Apartments Across Mass General Hospital
Calm & Modern Guest Room near Harvard Square
transit: If you are arriving from the airport, the easiest way would be to order a taxi/uber. It should cost between $20 and $30 depending on time and traffic and will take between 15 and 25 minutes. Unfortunately there is no efficient public transportation that would take under 1 hour.  If you are arriving to South Station via Train or Bus you can either take the Purple Line (Metro) which should be about 30 minutes or and Uber/Taxi which will cost $15 to $20 and take about 15 minutes. If you are driving, the address is very easy to find via GPS Navigation, and I have a parking spot behind the house.  Getting around after you have arrived is very easy. The apartment is especially well connected for car transportation and there is no place in Boston or Cambridge that should take you more than 15 minutes. As for public transportation, it will vary depending on your destination, but the fastest access is to Harvard Square and the Cambridge area. Here are some times to main points of interest: - Ha

Approximate 25 to 30mns).  By bus: Bus stop for Bus 18 is few houses away. Bus stop for Bus 8 and 41 is 7min walk from the house. name: Spacious & Elegant Historic Mansion Apt Park Views
transit: Logan Airport ✈:  Take an airport shuttle bus from your terminal to the Airport T subway station (blue line). Travel in-bound to State T station where you will need to get off and switch to the orange line in-bound. Get off at Roxbury Crossing, and walk up the hill in 5 mins. T (subway/metro)  🚇: The station is Roxbury Crossing and its the 3rd stop to Back Bay. Another 3 more stops from there takes you to Downtown Crossing. Blue Bikes sharing 🚲: $6 for a 24 hour pass or $12 for a 72 hour pass. I highly recommend this as a way to discover the city. Right at the T, subway station outside you'll see these bikes and the station is located on Boston's longest bike and walking path, the Southwest Corridor Park. 10 mins to Back Bay, 25 mins to Harvard Square.  Walk 👣: 5-15 minutes walk to local restaurants, bars and grocery store. 15 minutes walking distance to Longwood Medical Area, Northeastern University, Museum of Fine Arts, etc and 25 minutes to Fenway Park, South End. Boston is a walkin

name: Lux 1 Bedroom by Fenway with washer/dryer & WIFI
transit: Most locals get around town by foot, giving Boston the name, "the Walking City." Home to the first subway system in the United States, public transportation is well-developed, but congested, so many students, residents, and visitors choose to walk. When walking is not practical, the  Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority  offers commuter rail, rapid transit, light rail, bus, and trolley services. Logan International Airport, located in East Boston, is the area’s main airport. Fenway gives you everything you love about city living and with a T-stop right next door, you’ll be free to explore all Boston has to offer with ease.

name: Cozy Comfortable Travel Pad!
transit: At the end of our street (meaning 10 houses down) there is a bus that picks up and drops off at Forest Hills station (the ride is about 15 mins) from there you can take the Orange Line to wherever you please-- our commutes to the financial district are 50 minutes during rush hour in the morning.  Additionally, you could drive four minutes down the road and take the commuter rail into downtown Boston. In this case, you'd be looking at a 35-40 minute commute depending on the timing. There's also other park and ride options that we're happy to share if you have any questions!

name: Charming Apartment In The Heart Of Boston
transit: I highly recommend relying on public transportation (MBTA) to get to places. Some stations on the MBTA are Park, Haymarket, Charles/MGH, and Gov't Center. T stops are all within walking distance which allows easy access to Logan International Airport and the rest of the Greater Boston Area.  Also recommend Uber/Lyft.   Apps:  BostonMap, ParkBoston, MBTA or Moovit to get detailed step by step direction.  View detailed routes on a map, see bus and train schedules, arrival times.

If the weather is not conducive you can keep inside all around the BackBay area by walking through all the malls and motels and never have to go outside. The airport is less than 5 miles away so getting to and from the airport is a breeze.
